0.title: 7 injured as fire breaks out in parking area in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar
0.article_body: At least seven people suffered minor burn injuries after a fire broke out in the parking area of lane number 13 in Gurugram's Rajiv Nagar on Saturday, fire department officers said. Three motorcycles and two scooters were gutted, and the fire spread quickly towards a house, officers added. "It's suspected...short circuit in a motor caused the fire," an official said.

1.title: Cong denied permission to hold protest in Guj, police cites 'anti-govt slogans'
1.article_body: Congress was denied permission by police to hold a protest against "rising prices" and "unemployment" at Bahumali Bhavan Chowk in Gujarat's Rajkot. DCP Praveen Kumar cited the spread of COVID-19 and the possibility of raising anti-government slogans as the reasons for denying permission. Meanwhile, Congress alleged that the police is "acting as a tool in the hands of the BJP".

2.title: Himachal road transport bus skids off road, hits tree near Shimla; 4 injured
2.article_body: Four persons sustained injuries after a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus skidded off the road and crashed into a tree near Chaili village on the outskirts of Shimla. As per reports, the accident took place due to speeding. The injured persons, including the driver and conductor of the bus, were rushed to Indira Gandhi Medical College (IGMC) for treatment.

3.title: Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations: Russel Arnold
3.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Russel Arnold said GT captain Hardik Pandya has really not lived upto expectations, adding that there is a lot more to come from Hardik. "If he plays more balls, scores more runs...quietly gets his strike rate up and sets himself up for the death overs...I think he will be more destructive," added Russel.

4.title: Road accident victim's family gets over ₹ 35 lakh compensation in Punjab
4.article_body: The family of a 35-year-old man, who was killed after a truck hit his car near Punjab's Zirakpur in 2018, has been awarded a compensation of ₹35,35,400 lakh by Chandigarh's Motor Accident Claims Tribunal. The truck driver, owner and insurer had denied the petition. But the tribunal allowed the claim and awarded compensation to the victim's wife, child and parents.

5.title: Still 2 years younger for it: Amit Mishra to fan saying 'Sir, please come to CSK'
5.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra, who went unsold in IPL mega auction, took to Twitter to respond to a fan who had requested him to join CSK. "Sorry mate, still two years younger for it," the 39-year-old cricketer replied. Notably, in last few IPL seasons, CSK's average age was one of the highest, with fans terming the team as 'Dad's Army'.

6.title: If Rahul Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk: Kaif
6.article_body: Reacting to GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia's 13* off three balls against PBKS which included consecutive sixes with 12 runs needed off two balls, Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "If Tewatia was on Titanic, even that wouldn't have sunk". "Need Tewatia's statue in PBKS dugout," read Virender Sehwag's tweet. Irfan Pathan jokingly enquired on Twitter if Tewatia has some issue against PBKS.

7.title: They have a lot of problems: Harbhajan on CSK's worst start to IPL season
7.article_body: Talking about CSK recording their worst start in an IPL season, Harbhajan Singh said there are a lot of problems with the team which is why they have lost their first three IPL 2022 matches. "They do not have someone like Deepak Chahar, who can give them early wickets with the new ball," added Harbhajan.

8.title: Karnataka minister Eshwarappa, BJP corporator booked for hate speech
8.article_body: Karnataka Police has lodged an FIR against state minister KS Eshwarappa and BJP corporator Channabasappa on charges of making provocative statements following the murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha in Shivamogga. The complainant, who is a local resident, claimed that because of Eshwarappa's communal incitement and statements of provocation, Shivamogga witnessed violence after Harsha's murder.

9.title: We will never let Hindi be our national language: Siddaramaiah
9.article_body: Former Karnataka CM and Congress leader Siddaramaiah on Friday said that as a Kannadiga, he took "strong offence" to Union Minister Amit Shah urging people to talk in Hindi. He added, "Hindi isn't our national language and we will never let it...be." Earlier, Shah said that people in different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English.

10.title: Court dismisses Khalid Saifi's bail plea in 2020 Delhi riots case
10.article_body: A Delhi court rejected UAPA-accused and United Against Hate founder Khalid Saifi's bail plea in connection with a 2020 Northeast Delhi riots case. Saifi had connectivity with other accused and their cumulative role must be seen to comprehend the entire conspiracy, the court said. There was no evidence he gave a provocative speech to instigate anyone, Saifi's lawyer said.

11.title: Against the Constitution: TMC MP on Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark
11.article_body: TMC MP Saugata Roy criticised Amit Shah's remark that "people from different states should speak Hindi instead of English" and said that imposing Hindi in non-Hindi speaking states is "against" the Constitution. "If BJP forcibly wants to impose Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states then it will be protested and resisted. Even Nehru said that Hindi won't be imposed," Roy added.

12.title: Binance ready to follow sanctions on Russian officials: Ukraine
12.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has confirmed the "readiness to follow the sanctions policy on the Russian officials involved in military aggression", Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said. "During the call with Changpeng Zhao agreed on verifying their Ukrainian users," Fedorov added. Earlier in February, Fedorov called on major crypto exchanges to block Russian users' addresses.

13.title: Conflict in Ukraine's Donbas region could be knife fight: US
13.article_body: Eastern Ukraine's Donbas region, held by rebels, is becoming the "main scene of battle" after Russia failed to take the capital Kyiv, US Defense Department warned. Conflict in Donbas could be a "knife fight" as both sides are familiar with the terrain, population centres and access routes, a US defense official said. The fight could be "very bloody", official added.

14.title: Accused bite, assault Mumbai Police constables while resisting arrest
14.article_body: Three constables of Mumbai Police were injured after an accused and his accomplice, who were being escorted to the police station on Thursday, allegedly assaulted them. One of the accused, bit a constable's hand, whereas the other tore the uniform of another constable while trying to flee. However, the police overpowered them and brought them to police station.

15.title: Jennifer Lopez, Ben Affleck get engaged again, 18 years after their failed engagement
15.article_body: Singer-actor Jennifer Lopez and actor Ben Affleck are engaged once again. The 52-year-old shared a video of herself crying and looking at her engagement ring on Friday night on her official website. This comes 18 years after their first engagement had failed. Jennifer and Affleck had reunited last year, with Jennifer making the relationship public on her 52nd birthday.

16.title: Parliament can stop NGOs from receiving foreign funds: SC
16.article_body: Upholding the amendments in the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA), 2010, Supreme Court said that Parliament can stop non-governmental organisations (NGOs) from receiving foreign donations. "Receiving foreign donations cannot be an absolute or even a vested right," it added. "The foreign aid can create the presence of a foreign contributor...influence the country's policies," SC stated.

17.title: Pune woman kills husband, hangs body to pass off as suicide; held
17.article_body: A 40-year-old woman has been arrested in Pune for allegedly strangling her 44-year-old husband to death and then hanging his body to pass it off as suicide. The police questioned the woman and family after an autopsy revealed that the deceased was strangled. The woman confessed to the crime and claimed she'd done so due to her husband's constant harassment.

18.title: Conspiracy: Karnataka CM on hoax bomb threat at Bengaluru schools
18.article_body: After multiple schools in Bengaluru received hoax bomb threats via emails, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday claimed that this was a "conspiracy" to disturb the peace in the state. He added that police should "consider these cases seriously". A police officer said that the hoax bomb threats coincide with exams and they'd received similar hoax threats before during exams.

19.title: 33 students of law university in Gujarat test COVID-19 positive in last 2 days
19.article_body: As many as 25 students of Gujarat National Law University in Gujarat's Gandhinagar tested positive for COVID-19 on Friday, taking the tally of infected students to 33 since Thursday. Following this, Gandhinagar Municipal Corporation (GMC) has declared the campus a containment zone. "We have suspended offline classes. From Monday, classes will be held online," a university official said.

20.title: Russian missile that killed 52 at Ukraine station had 'for the children' written on it
20.article_body: A missile that struck a train station in Ukraine's Kramatorsk and killed 52 people, including five children, had the words "for the children" painted on it in Russian. Ukraine's Defence Ministry described it as "taking bestial brutality and moral depravity to the next level". The phrase translated as a message that the missile was sent in vengeance for children.

21.title: LSG look like they will struggle every time on paper: Graeme Smith
21.article_body: Ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said he thinks LSG are going to struggle every time he looks at their IPL 2022 squad on paper. "Their bowling attack is not outstanding on paper," added Smith. "But they are actually playing well as a team," stated Smith. LSG have won three out of their four IPL 2022 matches played so far.

22.title: 2 force-feed cycle tube solution to children in Guj to push them into begging
22.article_body: Two persons have been booked for allegedly force-feeding 'cycle tube solution' to around seven children, aged between seven and 12, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad in order to force them into street begging. The accused used to force a 16-year-old boy from Uttarakhand to sell drugs to the children and beat him up if he failed to provide them with sufficient money.

23.title: Fire at factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area, 6 firefighters injured
23.article_body: Six firefighters were injured while trying to douse the fire that broke out at a factory in Delhi's Anand Parbat Industrial Area on Saturday.  All the injured firefighters were rushed to B L Kapoor Hospital. The fire was reportedly caused due to blast in LPG cylinders at 4:45 am. Ten fire tenders were deployed to bring the fire under control.

24.title: Pic of Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat vs GT goes viral
24.article_body: A picture of PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal consoling Odean Smith after defeat against GT has gone viral on social media. Smith conceded 19 runs off the last overs, including 12 runs off the last two deliveries, as GT won by six wickets. "The last over could have been anyone's game," Agarwal said after the match.

25.title: RPF constable walks 4 kms on Mumbai's railway tracks to search commuter's phone
25.article_body: A Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable walked more than four kilometres on live railway tracks in WR's Mumbai division to look for newly purchased mobile phone of a traveller. The mobile phone of Deen Mohammed Qureshi, who was travelling on Dehradun Express, fell between Saphale and Vaitarna stations. Qureshi reached Saphale station at around 1 am to search his phone.

26.title: British, French divers rescued in Malaysia after over 2 days at sea
26.article_body: A French woman and a British man who disappeared while diving off the coast of Malaysia on Wednesday noon were found safe on Saturday, police said. Rescuers are still searching for Briton Adrian Chesters' 14-year-old son, who also went missing. The boat operator who took them to the dive site has been detained after testing positive for drugs, police added.

27.title: Which players have hit 2 sixes to win an IPL match with 12 runs needed off last 2 balls?
27.article_body: With 12 runs needed off last two deliveries, GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia smashed two sixes off Odean Smith to help his team defeat PBKS (formerly KXIP) in their IPL encounter. MS Dhoni is the only other player to have smashed two consecutive sixes on last two balls to win an IPL match. He had done so against PBKS in 2016.

28.title: Jharkhand govt extends time-limit for Ram Navami processions till 10 pm
28.article_body: The Jharkhand government has extended the time-limit for religious processions till 10 pm, in view of demands from various Ram Navami puja committees and political parties. Earlier on March 30, the state government had permitted the processions till 6 pm. State Health minister Banna Gupta had met CM Hemant Soren on Thursday and requested him to extend the time limit.

29.title: Pant's strike rate an issue, strong finish never came against LSG: Smith
29.article_body: Discussing DC captain Rishabh Pant's 39* off 36 balls at a strike rate of 108.33 in their loss against LSG, ex-South Africa captain Graeme Smith said Pant's strike rate is an issue. "The strong finish never came. DC needed to get...a total of 170-180," added Smith. LSG defeated DC by six wickets after being handed a target of 150 runs.

30.title: Amazon calls for new election after workers vote for 1st US union
30.article_body: Amazon has called for an election re-run after its NYC warehouse workers voted to create the company's first US union. It has accused the Amazon Labor Union (ALU) of intimidating workers and distributing marijuana to gain votes in its favour. "We want our employees to have their voices heard, and in this case, that didn't happen," an Amazon spokesperson said.

31.title: Hyd Police Commissioner rewards officers for Mahesh Bank hack probe
31.article_body: Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand rewarded 69 Cyber Crime team members for investigating the Mahesh Bank hack case, involving the illegal transfer of ₹12.48 crore. Further, 28 officers of various police stations were also honoured for their performance on Friday. The officers were rewarded on the basis of technical expertise, responsiveness, swift investigation and detection of cases.

32.title: 19-yr-old kills self in Chandigarh, parents allege harassment by friends
32.article_body: A 19-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide at his friend's paying guest (PG) room in Chandigarh. The deceased's parents have alleged that he was being harassed by other boys in the PG. His parents claimed the boys had recorded a video of him apologising to a girl for sexually harassing her in sleep and circulated it among his family members.

33.title: Hindus reject it: Tharoor on mahant's rape threat to Muslim women
33.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday reacted to the video of a Hindu mahant threatening to publicly rape Muslim women, saying, "The vast majority of Hindus reject and disown such elements." He added that as a Hindu, he can tell his Muslim friends that "thugs" like this don't represent Hindus just like an Islamic State extremist doesn't represent them.

34.title: EC transfers 2 police officers four days ahead of Asansol by-polls
34.article_body: Election Commission on Friday transferred two police officers of Asansol Durgapur Commissionerate, ahead of Asansol by-polls to be held on April 12. Abhijit Chatterjee, inspector in-charge of Asansol South Police Station, and Sanjib De of Jamuria Police Station were transferred out. The Asansol Lok Sabha seat fell vacant after former MP Babul Supriyo quit BJP last year to join TMC.

35.title: UP jails to play 'Gayatri Mantra' for inmates' peace of mind: Min
35.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Jail Dharmveer Prajapati on Friday announced that the 'Gayatri Mantra' and 'Mahamrityunjaya Mantra' will be played at the prisons across the state to provide inmates with "peace of mind". He also called for the organisation of sermons by "sants and mahants" at jails to "create a better atmosphere for prisoners".

36.title: AAP Himachal Pradesh president Anup Kesari, 2 others join BJP
36.article_body: Anup Kesari, president of Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Himachal Pradesh unit, along with general secretary organisation Satish Thakur and Unna chief Iqbal Singh joined BJP. "Arvind Kejriwal overlooked the state AAP workers when he came for a rally...they considered this ignorance...quit for self-respect," Kesari said. "Only Kejriwal...Bhagwant Mann participated in the roadshow," Singh said.

37.title: Punjab govt failed to maintain law and order, regulate sand prices: Sidhu
37.article_body: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu criticised the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government and said that the state government is "failing" to maintain law and order situation and regulate the sand prices in Punjab. "Only announcements are being made...no notification regarding any announcement has been issued so far. The price of electricity is also likely to increase from the next month," he said.

38.title: 7 arrested for dancing to music on roof of moving cars in Maha's Nagpur
38.article_body: As many as seven persons were arrested for allegedly dancing to music on the roof of moving cars in Sadar area of Maharashtra's Nagpur, a police officer said. The matter came to light when a video of the alleged incident went viral on social media, he added. A total of five cars have been seized so far.

39.title: Sonam-Anand's Delhi residence robbed; cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore stolen: Report
39.article_body: Actor Sonam Ahuja and Anand Ahuja's Delhi residence was robbed and cash and jewellery worth ₹1.41 crore was stolen, as per a report. In a police complaint lodged on February 23, Anand's grandmother Sarla claimed that she got to know of the theft on February 11 when she checked her cupboards for jewellery and cash, the report added.

40.title: Moderna recalls 7,64,900 COVID-19 vaccine doses over contamination in Europe
40.article_body: Moderna has said it is recalling 7,64,900 doses of its COVID-19 vaccine made by its contract manufacturer Rovi after a vial was found contaminated. No safety issues have been identified in the lots that were distributed in Norway, Poland, Portugal, Spain and Sweden in January, Moderna added. Moderna was recalling the whole lot out of "an abundance of caution".

41.title: India declares 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed's son a designated terrorist
41.article_body: The Ministry of Home Affairs has issued a notification declaring Hafiz Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Mohammad Saeed, as a designated terrorist. "Hafiz Talha Saeed has been actively involved in recruitment, fund collection, planning and executing attacks by...LeT in India and Indian interests in Afghanistan," MHA said. His father had masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks.

42.title: They're being misled: Pawar as MSRTC employees protest outside his house
42.article_body: After over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday, he said that they are being misled. "ST employees and we have a very old relationship, in the last 40-50 years I've not missed any session with them," Pawar added. Notably, police arrested MSRTC employees' leader Gunaratna Sadavarte.

43.title: Punjab to set up 333 urban wellness centres: Health Minister
43.article_body: Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla on Friday announced Punjab government will set up 333 urban wellness centres in urban and semi-urban areas across the state. "The government will be utilising public buildings...rest of infrastructure, including machines and laboratories will be provided by the department," Singla said. "A special fund will be allocated in the budget for this project," he added.

44.title: 1,150 new COVID-19 cases, 83 deaths reported in India in last 24 hours
44.article_body: India reported 1,150 new COVID-19 cases and 83 new deaths in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 11,365. The death toll due to COVID-19 in India has risen to 5,21,656. Kerala has the highest number of active COVID-19 cases in the country at 3,190, followed by Karnataka (1,501 cases).

45.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian gunman who killed 3 people in a bar
45.article_body: Israeli security forces on Friday hunted down and killed a Palestinian man who had opened fire into a crowded bar in Tel Aviv on Thursday, killing three people and injuring several others. The gunman, identified as a 28-year-old from Jenin, was reportedly in Israel without a permit. It was the fourth deadly attack in Israel by Palestinians in three weeks.

46.title: UP CMO's Twitter account briefly hacked, profile pic changed to 'Bored Ape'
46.article_body: The Twitter account of UP CM's Office was briefly hacked on Saturday. The breach came to light when unknown hackers used the account to publish a post based on a tutorial called "How to turn your BAYC/MAYC animated on Twitter". Additionally, the profile picture of the account was also changed to 'Bored Ape' and the location was changed to 'Metaverse'.

47.title: Macron calls Polish PM 'far-right anti-Semite' amid Putin talks row
47.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron has called Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki "a far-right anti-Semite who bans LGBT people". This came after Morawiecki criticised his phone calls with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the Ukraine invasion. The Polish PM had compared Macron's efforts to negotiating with Hitler. Poland has summoned the French ambassador to Warsaw over Macron's comments.

48.title: 250 Marathi medium educated teachers denied job in BMC English schools
48.article_body: Around 250 teachers who have studied in Marathi medium have been protesting for 150 days at Mumbai's Azad Maidan against being denied jobs in BMC English schools. BMC is contradicting itself by asking schools to put up their names in Marathi letters on one hand and denying them jobs over their medium of instruction on the other, the protesters said.

49.title: Tesla, Jack Dorsey's Block to mine Bitcoin using solar power in US
49.article_body: Tesla, Twitter Founder Jack Dorsey's Block and blockchain company Blockstream will together mine Bitcoin using solar power in Texas, Blockstream CEO Adam Back said. Tesla's 3.8 megawatt solar PV array and 12 megawatt-hour Megapack will power the facility. The project will have a publicly available dashboard showing real-time metrics of its performance, including power output and Bitcoin mined.

50.title: K'taka CM inaugurates Sanjeevini SARAS fair in B'luru; buys sarees
50.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday inaugurated the Sanjeevini SARAS fair at the campus of Bengaluru's National College Basavanagudi. Bommai also purchased sarees from the various self-help groups at the fair, which was organised by Karnataka's entrepreneurship and livelihood department. About 300 stalls that were set up at the fair, displayed the work of women from across the country.

51.title: Pune to see day temperatures around 40°C till Apr 14, rain unlikely in coming days: IMD
51.article_body: The day temperatures in Pune will continue to hover around 40 degrees Celsius till April 14, according to the IMD. "There's no chance of rain in Pune in the coming few days. There will be partly cloudy conditions for the next 48 hours, after which the sky will be clear," head of the weather forecasting department at IMD Pune said.

52.title: Pune police file FIR as 13 cheated of ₹2.53 cr in admissions scam
52.article_body: Pune's Yerwada police station has filed an FIR after about 13 people were cheated of ₹2.53 crore by a group of men under the pretext of getting admission at a medical college in Nashik. This comes after one of the 13 people filed a complaint claiming that the accused took ₹30.72 lakh and promised his child's admission to the college.

53.title: 2 held at Amritsar airport for smuggling 10 kg gold from Sharjah
53.article_body: Two persons were arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) at Amritsar airport on Tuesday for smuggling gold from Sharjah (UAE). They recovered 10 kg of gold worth around ₹1.9 crore from them that was hidden in their clothes and headgear to evade customs duty. The accused are residents of Jalandhar and had visited UAE on a tourist visa.

54.title: Over 10 shanties gutted as fire breaks out at slum cluster in Gurugram
54.article_body: Over 10 shanties were gutted after a fire broke out at a slum cluster in Gurugram's Sector 74 on the Southern Peripheral Road on Friday evening, officials said. No casualties were reported, officials added. The fire had spread across an area of over 1.5 acres due to plastic and polythene material that had been collected at the cluster, officials stated.

55.title: 4-foot-long spectacled cobra rescued from Andheri
55.article_body: A four-foot-long spectacled cobra was rescued by Resqink Association for Wildlife Welfare (RAWW) from Mumbai's Andheri around midnight on Thursday. The venomous cobra was spotted behind a water tank in a house inhabited by nearly 10 labourers. According to RAWW member Sahil Vichare, the house is a part of slum area, thus making it easy for the cobra to enter.

56.title: Will Smith banned from attending Oscars for 10 years
56.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been banned from attending Oscars and other Academy events for 10 years after he slapped Chris Rock at Oscars 2022 ceremony. In a statement, the Academy said the 94th Oscars had been "overshadowed by the unacceptable and harmful behaviour" exhibited by Smith. It added that banning Smith was aimed at protecting performers and guests.

57.title: Delhi sees hottest day of year so far with maximum temperature at 41.6°C
57.article_body: Amid a 'severe heatwave', Delhi on Friday recorded a maximum temperature of 41.6°C, the highest so far this year, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The maximum temperature at most places in Delhi on Friday settled at least seven degrees above normal. IMD has issued an orange alert, warning of a 'severe heatwave' in Delhi on Saturday too.

58.title: He knows he won't win so decided to campaign for India? Pak PM Imran's ex-wife
58.article_body: After Pakistan PM Imran Khan praised India ahead of a trust vote, his ex-wife Reham Khan said, "He knows he can't win again so decided to campaign for India? Khudaar qaum suddenly!!" Imran had said, "Indians are khuddar quam (very self-respecting people). No superpower can dictate terms to India." "Pakistan gets used as...tissue paper and thrown away," he added.

59.title: Bengaluru bans sale of meat on Rama Navami, official says routine order
59.article_body: The Bengaluru civic body issued an order prohibiting animal slaughter and sale of meat on Rama Navami on April 10. Every year there is a blanket ban on sale of meat and animal slaughter on Rama Navami and such bans are imposed on at least eight days a year on events like Gandhi Jayanti, Sarvodaya Day, a BBMP official said.

60.title: 2 arrested with heroin worth ₹5.7 crore hidden in water bottles in Mumbai
60.article_body: Mumbai Police has arrested two persons and seized heroin worth ₹5.7 crore concealed in water bottles, which had specially-made sections in bottom halves to smuggle the contraband. Police also checked the bag the accused were carrying and found more heroin in it. Police had been on the lookout for one of the accused, a woman, for the past seven months.

61.title: Tewatia smashes 2 sixes on last 2 balls as GT defeat PBKS to win 3rd match in a row
61.article_body: With 12 runs needed to win on the last two deliveries, Gujarat Titans (GT) all-rounder Rahul Tewatia smashed two sixes to help his team chase down the 190-run target against PBKS. GT have now won three matches in a row and are currently the only unbeaten side in IPL 2022. Opener Shubman Gill top-scored for Gujarat Titans with 96(59).

62.title: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt to get married on April 14, confirms her uncle
62.article_body: Robin Bhatt has confirmed that Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt are set to tie the knot on April 14, according to India Today. Robin is Mahesh Bhatt's half-brother and a writer in Bollywood. Alia's mehendi ceremony will take place on April 13, India Today further said. The couple will reportedly get married in an intimate ceremony.

63.title: I accept SC verdict with heavy heart but disappointed: Pak PM ahead of no-trust vote
63.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Friday said he is very upset with the Supreme Court's ruling in favour of the no-trust vote against him. Khan, who's set to face a no-confidence vote tomorrow, said, "I accept...court's verdict with heavy heart, but I'm...disappointed." The court had termed National Assembly Deputy Speaker's decision to dismiss the no-confidence motion against Khan as "unconstitutional".

64.title: US envoy said Imran Khan should not have visited Moscow: Pak PM
64.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday said in an address to the nation that the US ambassador told his Pakistani counterparts that Imran Khan should not have visited Moscow to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The US also said Pakistan would suffer if he survived the no-confidence vote called against him by the opposition, Khan added.

65.title: No superpower can dictate terms to India: Pakistan PM Imran Khan
65.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan, while addressing the nation on the eve of no-trust vote, highlighted India's foreign policy. Khan said he is "in awe of the functioning of the neighbouring country which does not allow any foreign power to make decisions for it". He added that no superpower can dictate terms to India.

66.title: Imran Khan cries while praising India, says 'I got lots of love there'
66.article_body: Imran Khan broke down while praising India during the live address to Pakistani citizens ahead of no-confidence vote against him. "Now we have to decide what kind of Pakistan do we want...I know India better than others. I had friendships in India because of cricket. I got lots of love and respect there," he said as he got emotional.

67.title: I feel he's holding back: Shastri on new CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja
67.article_body: Commenting on defending champions CSK's new skipper Ravindra Jadeja, who replaced MS Dhoni ahead of IPL 2022, Ravi Shastri said Jadeja needs to be involved and announce himself more. "I feel he's holding back. I want him to be more in the face...have more communication with his boys...be more involved in...proceedings," he explained. CSK have been winless so far.

68.title: Alternatives to Russian weapons are too expensive, India told US: Bloomberg report
68.article_body: India has conveyed to the US that the alternatives to Russian weapons are too expensive, Bloomberg reported citing people aware of India-US exchanges on the Russian invasion of Ukraine. As per the report, US Assistant Secretary of State Victoria Nuland had offered help to India in finding alternative sources of weapons to counter neighbours Pakistan and China.

69.title: 3 businessmen pay $55 million each for 10-day trip to Space Station
69.article_body: SpaceX on Friday launched three businessmen and a retired NASA astronaut to the International Space Station (ISS). The businessmen are paying $55 million each to Axiom Space for their 10-day trip. The crew will spend eight days on the US portion of the ISS and conduct 25 science experiments. The launch marks the first fully private mission to the ISS.

70.title: Friends gift bottles of petrol & diesel to newly-wed couple in TN
70.article_body: A newly-wed couple, Grace Kumar and his bride Keerthana, was gifted bottles of petrol and diesel by their friends recently, pictures of which have surfaced on social media. The incident took place in the Chengalpattu district of Tamil Nadu. Petrol and diesel are priced over ₹110 and over ₹100 per litre in the state respectively.

71.title: Video of pet dog beaten to death by healthcare worker in China sparks criticism
71.article_body: Authorities in China are facing criticism after a video showed a corgi being beaten to death by a healthcare worker in locked-down city of Shanghai. The dog's owners tested COVID-19 positive and were taken to a quarantine centre. The corgi chased the van for a short distance as it left, after which the worker hit the dog with a spade.

72.title: RCB's Karthik, KKR's Umesh look most settled in their new team: Bhogle
72.article_body: On being asked about players who looked most settled in their new team in IPL 2022, commentator Harsha Bhogle picked RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik and KKR pacer Umesh Yadav. "Karthik goes back to RCB and he's finishing like he has not gone anywhere," he added. With nine wickets from four matches, Umesh is currently the leading wicket-taker in the tournament.

73.title: Jurgen Klopp is biggest rival I've ever had: Man City's Pep Guardiola
73.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is "the biggest rival I've ever had in my career". Guardiola previously faced off against Real Madrid's Jose Mourinho when he was the manager of Barcelona. "In the last five years they have been the biggest opponent," Guardiola said. Manchester City will face Liverpool in the Premier League on Sunday.

74.title: We can't afford to drop points anymore: Man Utd's Rangnick on PL season
74.article_body: Manchester United interim boss Ralf Rangnick on Friday said his team cannot afford to drop any more points this season if they wish to finish in the top four of the Premier League. Manchester United face 17th placed Everton in the Premier League on Saturday. "We're all aware of the importance of the game for both sides," Rangnick said.

75.title: €240 million allocated by UEFA for clubs in 2020-24 benefits programme
75.article_body: UEFA on Friday said it has allocated €240 million to pay clubs for releasing their players for national team competitions as part of its benefits programme for the 2020-2024 cycle. The amount is based on the total generated by the European Championship tournament. UEFA said €200 million was paid to 697 clubs across all 55 member associations after EURO 2020.

76.title: 53-year-old woman's skin cells 'de-aged' by 30 years in trial by UK researchers
76.article_body: In a new trial conducted by researchers in UK's Cambridge, the skin cells of a 53-year-old woman were successfully 'de-aged' by 30 years. The partially rejuvenated cells showed signs of behaving more like youthful cells in wound simulations, the Babraham Institute said. The technology used is built on the techniques employed to create Dolly the cloned sheep in 1996.

77.title: EU adopts 5th package of sanctions against Russia; bans coal imports
77.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Friday adopted its fifth package of sanctions against Russia following its invasion of Ukraine that includes a ban on the import of Russian coal. The ban on coal imports will be fully effective from the second week of August. The new sanctions also prevent Russian trucks and vessels from accessing the EU.

78.title: We have significant losses of troops: Russia on Ukraine invasion
78.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Thursday admitted Russia has suffered "significant losses of troops" following its invasion of Ukraine which began on February 24. "It's a huge tragedy for us," Peskov added. Ukrainian authorities have claimed at least 18,900 Russian troops have been killed in combat so far. The UN said over four million people have fled Ukraine so far.

79.title: Want to make good impression again: Bairstow on joining new IPL team PBKS
79.article_body: Speaking about joining PBKS in IPL 2022, batter Jonny Bairstow said he's enjoying it as it's a new franchise with a new group of players. "Obviously, it's an exciting time. You want to make...good impression again," he added. He further said that brand of cricket PBKS are playing is great. PBKS is Bairstow's second franchise in IPL after SRH.

80.title: Heroin worth ₹18 crore hidden in soap cases seized from car in Assam
80.article_body: Assam Police on Thursday seized 2.275 kilograms of heroin worth ₹18 crore from a car in Karimganj. According to the police, the drugs were kept hidden in 175 soap cases inside the four secret chambers of the car, which was coming from Aizawl. Further, police arrested four persons involved in the case and also seized the car.

81.title: 2 killed after fire breaks out in COVID-19 hospital in Greece
81.article_body: Authorities said two people have died due to a fire that broke out on Wednesday in a COVID-19 hospital in Greece. Firefighters discovered the body of a 79-year-old COVID-19 patient on Wednesday while a 52-year-old man died of his injuries on Thursday. Another patient is being treated for burns in the hospital. Over 30 patients were evacuated from the ward.

82.title: PBKS' Liam Livingstone smashes second-fastest fifty of IPL 2022
82.article_body: PBKS' Liam Livingstone on Friday smashed the second-fastest fifty of IPL 2022 by reaching the 50-run mark off 21 deliveries against GT. The 28-year-old scored 64 runs off 27 deliveries, including seven fours and four sixes. KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the fastest fifty of IPL 2022 and joint-fastest fifty in IPL history off 14 deliveries against MI on April 6.

83.title: Akshata Murthy, wife of UK minister Rishi Sunak is richer than the Queen: Report
83.article_body: Akshata Murthy, the wife of British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and daughter of Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, is reportedly richer than the Queen, whose personal wealth is about £350 million. With an estimated fortune of £690 million (over ₹6,834 crore), 42-year-old Akshata owns a 0.9% stake in Infosys, worth £430 million. She also receives about £11.5 million in annual dividends.

84.title: German Parliament rejects vaccine mandate for people aged over 60
84.article_body: The German Parliament on Thursday rejected a proposal for a COVID-19 vaccine mandate for people aged over 60. The Bill was supported by Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Health Minister Karl Lauterbach. Out of 674 MPs, 378 voted against a vaccine mandate while 296 voted for it. A recent opinion poll showed that about 60% of Germans support a vaccine mandate.

85.title: US to supply Ukraine with new weapon systems
85.article_body: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the US will send new weapon systems to Ukraine after NATO foreign ministers decided to increase arms deliveries to Ukraine following the atrocities in Bucha by Russian forces. "We're not going to let anything stand in the way of getting Ukrainians what they need, and what we believe, to be effective," Blinken said.

86.title: Many felt I'm showing feminine traits: Nawazuddin on playing Laila
86.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, speaking about his role Laila in 'Heropanti 2', said that he incorporated the character's traits in his real life including Laila's walk and feminine touch. "Many...told me that my walk is different from my usual style. Many thought I am displaying feminine qualities," he added. Nawazuddin further said he dropped the mannerisms after the shoot was completed.

87.title: I'm trying not to put myself in any box as an actor: Ananya Panday
87.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday has stated that she is trying not to put herself in any sort of box as an actor. Ananya added that she wants to try a little bit of everything and evolve with every film and character that she does. "'Liger' is very different from a 'Gehraiyaan' or even a 'Kho Gaye Hum Kahan'," the actress said.

88.title: Taiwan Prez tests COVID-19 -ve after relative she met tests positive
88.article_body: Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen's office on Friday said she tested negative for COVID-19 after a relative she shared a meal with at her residence tested positive. Presidential Office Spokesperson Xavier Chang said Tsai is in good health but will continue to work from home until April 14. Chang added all her public events will be cancelled during the same period.

89.title: Red Bull are a 'tiny bit' off Ferrari: Verstappen ahead of Aus GP
89.article_body: Formula One world champion Max Verstappen on Friday said Red Bull are a "tiny bit" off Ferrari after both practice sessions ahead of the Australian Grand Prix. Verstappen finished second fastest behind Ferrari's Charles Leclerc during the second practice session. "We definitely made some good improvements today," Verstappen said. The Dutch driver won the previous Grand Prix in Saudi Arabia.

90.title: 21-year-old Indian student shot dead outside subway station in Canada
90.article_body: A 21-year-old student, Kartik Vasudev, from Ghaziabad in Uttar Pradesh was shot dead in Canada's Toronto while he was on his way to his part-time job on Thursday, police said. He was reportedly killed in a robbery attempt. "We are shocked & distressed at the unfortunate killing...We are in touch with the family," the Consulate General of India tweeted.

91.title: They're amazing together, hope everything goes well: Neetu on Alia-Ranbir
91.article_body: Veteran actress Neetu Kapoor, on being asked about her son actor Ranbir Kapoor's wedding with actress Alia Bhatt, stated that they are amazing together. "I just love both of them and they are amazing human beings. They complement each other really well...I am really hoping everything goes well," she added. Alia and Ranbir are rumoured to get married in April.

92.title: It was a difficult session: Mercedes' Hamilton ahead of Aus Grand Prix
92.article_body: Lewis Hamilton said the second practice session of the Australian Grand Prix was "a difficult session" as Hamilton and teammate George Russell finished outside the top 10. Hamilton was 13th fastest while Russell finished 11th fastest in the session. "It's just nothing you change on the car makes a difference at the moment, so that's the difficult thing," he said.

93.title: Life in the Himalayas: ITBP as it shares pics taken by jawans
93.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) took to its Instagram page recently to share pictures taken by the jawans. "Life in the #Himalayas. Pictures by #Himveers," the caption of the post read. "The wonders of Himalayas," a person commented on the post while praising the pictures. "Superb clicks," another comment read.

94.title: He gives players freedom to express themselves: Gill on GT captain Hardik
94.article_body: Gujarat Titans opener Shubman Gill has praised captain Hardik Pandya for giving players the "freedom and confidence" to play the way as they would want to in the ongoing IPL. He added that this quality makes Hardik "special" as a captain. GT are currently the only unbeaten team in IPL 2022 after two matches. They are fourth in the standings.

95.title: Barcelona draw 1-1 with Eintracht Frankfurt in Europa League quarter-final
95.article_body: Barcelona on Thursday were held to a 1-1 draw with Eintracht Frankfurt in the first-leg of their UEFA Europa League quarter-final. Ansgar Knauff scored in the 48th minute to give Frankfurt the lead before Ferran Torres equalised for Barcelona in the 66th minute. Elsewhere, RB Leipzig drew 1-1 with Atalanta while West Ham United drew 1-1 with Lyon.

96.title: It's been a lifestyle change for me: Ranbir on transformation for 'Animal'
96.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, speaking about his physical transformation for upcoming film 'Animal', has said that it has been a lifestyle change for him. "I think that will be very challenging for me after 'Sanju'," the actor added. He further said that he wants to do it correctly with diet and the correct amount of workout, rest and recovery.

97.title: We're in a position to start testing, running pilot digital rupee projects: RBI
97.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is in a position to start off with testing and running pilot projects of central bank digital currency (CBDC) or digital rupee, Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar said. He added that the RBI will take a calibrated and nuanced approach towards CBDC and ensure that it is introduced in a manner that is non-disruptive.

98.title: Posing as govt officials, gang steals 60-foot iron bridge built 50 yrs ago in Bihar
98.article_body: A gang of thieves posing as officers of the State Irrigation Department allegedly stole a 60-feet defunct iron bridge in Bihar. The accused used gas cutters and earthmover machines to demolish the bridge, which was built in 1972. They also took the help of locals during the removal of the bridge. A police case has been filed in the matter.

99.title: 3 jailed for life for raping 2 girls, passing it as suicide in Assam
99.article_body: A fast-track court in Assam's Kokrajhar district sentenced three men to life imprisonment for raping two minor tribal girls in June 2021. The rapists had tried to stage it as suicide and hence hung the bodies of the girls from a tree. The SIT had solved the case within 48 hours. Police had arrested a total of seven people.

100.title: It seems there's Taliban rule in Rajasthan: Poonia on Karauli violence
100.article_body: Rajasthan BJP president Satish Poonia on Friday said, "The way CM Ashok Gehlot is doing the politics of appeasement in Rajasthan, it seems that there is Taliban rule in the state." He claimed the human rights of people are being violated in Rajasthan. The BJP leader further demanded a judicial investigation into clashes that broke out in Karauli last week.

101.title: SpaceX launches first all-private astronaut crew to the Space Station
101.article_body: SpaceX on Friday launched four civilian astronauts to the International Space Station (ISS), marking the first time a completely private crew has visited the ISS. The crew, led by former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría, includes Canadian investor Mark Pathy, American investor Larry Connor, and former Israeli Air Force pilot Eytan Stibbe. The crew will spend eight days on the ISS.

102.title: His retirement was a shocker: Maxwell on RCB teammate De Villiers
102.article_body: Recalling his RCB teammate AB de Villiers' retirement from all forms of cricket in November 2021, batter Glenn Maxwell said the announcement came as a "little bit of a shocker". He added, "I thought he was probably going to go one more year...he's still a superstar...has played the roles for us and he was still leading by [an] example."

103.title: There's a new trend of govts maligning judges, it is unfortunate: CJI
103.article_body: Chief Justice of India NV Ramana has said that there's a "new trend" of governments "maligning" judges if judgments aren't to their liking, adding, "It's unfortunate." He said this while hearing an appeal by the Chhattisgarh government challenging HC's decision to quash an FIR against an ex-IAS officer. "Whatever fight you may take...don't try to malign the courts," said Ramana.

104.title: 1st time I messaged a girl on a dating app, I called her sis: Lilly on being bisexual
104.article_body: YouTuber-comedian Lilly Singh, speaking to Vogue India about her dating life after revealing she's bisexual, said, "A big part of it was learning how to flirt with girls." "The first time I messaged a girl on a dating app, I called her sis. I literally had to stop...myself," she added. Lilly further said she is "getting better at it".

105.title: Customer sues Burger King in US, claims Whoppers smaller than advertised
105.article_body: A customer in the US has filed a lawsuit against Burger King, accusing them of misleading customers with the size of their Whoppers. The lawsuit claimed the burger is 35% smaller than advertised. It also argued that Burger King began inflating the size of its burgers in photos around September 2017, while before it, products were advertised "more fairly".

106.title: We're not aware of it: NPCI as Coinbase says users can buy crypto with UPI
106.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has clarified it's not aware of any crypto exchange using UPI after US-based Coinbase said it will allow users to buy cryptocurrencies with UPI. Coinbase later said that it was aware of the recent statement published by NPCI. "We are committed to working with NPCI and other relevant authorities," the crypto exchange said.

107.title: He came from nothing and built a world-class firm: UK FM on Narayana Murthy
107.article_body: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak praised his father-in-law and Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy and said, "He came from nothing and has created a world-class business." He added, "If I achieved a tenth of what my father-in-law achieved in his life, I'd be a happy person." Sunak's statements come amid controversy over his India-born wife Akshata Murthy's non-domicile tax status.

108.title: Bombay HC grants bail to man accused of killing wife's lover
108.article_body: The Bombay HC on Wednesday granted bail to a man, who was booked in Pune for allegedly killing the lover of his wife. HC said the witnesses haven't supported their claims. It was claimed that the deceased and the accused's wife continued their affair despite getting married. Thus, according to the prosecution, the applicant had assaulted him on being annoyed.

109.title: 19-yr-old girl poisoned by college classmates for refusing to have sex in Raj; dies
109.article_body: A 19-year-old college girl died during treatment in Rajasthan's Bharatpur after five of her male classmates allegedly poisoned her for refusing to have sex with them, police said. The students allegedly followed her when she was returning home on Wednesday and forcefully made her drink some liquid, following which she started vomiting, the police added.

110.title: Centre writes to 4 states and 1 UT over rise in COVID-19 cases
110.article_body: Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan has written to the governments of Delhi, Haryana, Kerala, Maharashtra and Mizoram over the increase in COVID-19 cases there over the past week. The states have been asked to strictly monitor the cases and take pre-emptive action if necessary, ANI reported. India reported 1,109 new COVID-19 cases on Friday.

111.title: Important to reveal name: Sehwag as Chahal claims a drunk cricketer hung him from balcony
111.article_body: After Yuzvendra Chahal claimed that a cricketer hung him from a 15th-floor balcony in a Bengaluru hotel after getting drunk in 2013, Virender Sehwag said it is important to reveal the name of the player. "If true, this cannot be treated as fun, important to know what happened and what action was taken considering the seriousness of this," Sehwag added.

112.title: Publication didn't print my spiritual journey due to bikini pics: Sofia
112.article_body: Television personality and self-styled godwoman Sofia Hayat has revealed that a major publication interviewed her about her spiritual journey but decided not to run it due to her bikini pictures on Instagram. "Because how can a former nun be spiritual and have the gifts...I would rather go naked because that's my pure natural sacred state," Sofia wrote on Instagram.

113.title: I've played myself in films, don't want to do that anymore: Usha Uthup
113.article_body: Veteran singer-actress Usha Uthup has stated that she has played herself in films, adding that she doesn't want to do that anymore. "I don't mind playing a small character as long as it adds meaning to the story," she added. Usha further said that she has worked with actors like Mammootty, Kamal Haasan, Naseeruddin Shah, Amitabh Bachchan and Annu Kapoor.

114.title: It's a dream come true: Rajapaksa on representing PBKS in his maiden IPL
114.article_body: Sharing his maiden IPL experience, PBKS batter Bhanuka Rajapaksa said, "It's been a dream come true." He added, "My wife...broke the news to me that I had been bought by PBKS...it's sort of a miracle that I got into...same side that I've been supporting since I was a kid." Rajapaksa has scored total 83 runs in IPL 2022 so far.

115.title: Raj govt orders probe into Karauli incident, wants report in 15 days
115.article_body: The Rajasthan government on Friday ordered an administrative probe into clashes that broke out in Karauli last week, ANI reported. The report would have to be submitted within 15 days. Notably, communal clashes broke out in Karauli on Saturday, injuring over 25 persons. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot had earlier assured of strict action against those responsible for the Karauli incident.

116.title: Man walks on rope tied between 2 hot air balloons at 6,236 ft to create Guinness record
116.article_body: Guinness World Records recently shared a video of the world record attempt for the 'highest slackline walk' and it has gone viral. The video shows a man named Rafael Zugno Bridi from Brazil walking barefoot on a rope tied between two hot air balloons flying midair. He successfully created the record at 1,901 metres (6,236 ft).

117.title: Gang steals 1,600 kg of cheese worth ₹17 lakh from dairy farm in Netherlands
117.article_body: A gang of thieves allegedly stole 1,600 kilos of cheese worth $23,000 (around ₹17 lakh) from a dairy farm in the Netherlands. A farmer at the dairy said that almost all the cheese from their storage was taken. As per an official, the stolen cheese is transported to countries like Russia where Dutch cheese cannot be bought due to sanctions.

118.title: Earliest-known galaxy spotted 13.5 bn light-years away, pic released
118.article_body: Astronomers have discovered what appears to be the earliest, most distant galaxy ever spotted- a galaxy named HD1. It is estimated to be 13.5 billion light-years away from Earth and is said to have existed 330 million years after the Big Bang. "HD1 would represent a giant baby in the delivery room of the early universe," said an astronomer.

119.title: GT to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs announced
119.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their IPL 2022 clash. GT have made two changes to their playing XI, with Sai Sudharsan and Darshan Nalkande replacing Vijay Shankar and Varun Aaron. Meanwhile, Jonny Bairstow has replaced Bhanuka Rajapaksa in PBKS' playing XI.

120.title: Mahesh Babu Foundation sponsors heart surgeries of 30 children
120.article_body: Telugu actor Mahesh Babu's non-profit organisation Mahesh Babu Foundation sponsored the heart surgeries and interventions of 30 children with the help of Andhra Hospitals on the occasion of World Health Day. His wife actress Namrata Shirodkar took to Instagram to share pictures of a few of the children and announced Andhra Pradesh Governor Sri Biswa Bhusan Harichandan felicitated the event.

121.title: RBI imposes monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank, ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank
121.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a monetary penalty of ₹93 lakh on Axis Bank and ₹90 lakh on IDBI Bank. RBI fined Axis Bank for non-compliance with directions on loans and advances, KYC guidelines and penalties on non-maintenance of minimum balance in savings accounts. IDBI Bank was fined for reporting frauds to RBI with delay, among other things.

122.title: She found out husband is gay on honeymoon, read his chats: Lawyer of Maha woman
122.article_body: The lawyer of the 29-year-old woman who filed a complaint against her husband for cheating her by hiding that he's gay has said she came to know about his sexual orientation during their honeymoon. "While checking his mobile phone...she found his unusual WhatsApp chat with some people," he added. A court in Maharashtra's Thane rejected the man's anticipatory bail plea.

123.title: Couple steals jewellery & cash worth ₹5 lakh from friend's house in Thane
123.article_body: A couple has been arrested for allegedly stealing jewellery and cash worth ₹5 lakh from the house of a friend in Thane. The accused woman convinced her friend to allow her to stay in her house. "Two days ahead of the incident, she also called her husband, and one more man who allegedly is her boyfriend," police said.

124.title: Interview of Chahal claiming drunk Symonds, Franklin tied him, taped his mouth resurfaces
124.article_body: An interview of Yuzvendra Chahal claiming his then MI teammates Andrew Symonds and James Franklin tied him in a Chennai hotel and taped his mouth after getting drunk in 2011 has resurfaced. Chahal said he was freed after a cleaner saw him the next morning. The interview resurfaced after Chahal claimed a cricketer hung him from 15th-floor balcony in 2013.

125.title: 26/11 mastermind Hafiz Saeed sentenced to 31 years in jail by Pak court
125.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Pakistan has sentenced Lashkar-e-Taiba co-founder Hafiz Saeed to 31 years in prison and also ordered the confiscation of all his assets. The terrorist, who masterminded the 26/11 Mumbai terror attacks, has also been reportedly fined PKR 3,40,000. The action has reportedly been taken in two cases of terror financing.

126.title: It was tough raising kids alone; Mira brought us together: Neliima
126.article_body: Actors Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter's mother Neliima Azeem has stated that she raised her children as a single mother and it was very tough in those days. "[Shahid's wife Mira Rajput] has brought our entire family together," she added. Neliima further said that she is happy to watch her sons do exceptionally good work after struggling for many years.

127.title: Mosquito density up by 50% in South Delhi in a year: SDMC survey
127.article_body: A six-day survey conducted by the health department of the South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has revealed that the mosquito density has increased by 50% from last year in the areas of south Delhi. The survey, which was conducted between March 28 and April 2, reveals that most of the mosquitoes detected do not spread dengue, malaria or chikungunya.

128.title: Hatred is being spread & country is being divided: Rahul Gandhi
128.article_body: After meeting Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Sharad Yadav, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that hatred is being spread and the country is being divided. Rahul said, "I agree with what he (Sharad Yadav) said today that the country is in a very bad situation." "India was one nation earlier, [BJP] has created different nations within the nation now," he added.

129.title: Rare 'one-in 200-million' identical triplet boys from UK to turn 1, pics go viral
129.article_body: The parents of "one-in-200 million" identical triplet boys, Jimmy, Jenson and Jaxson, from Cheshire are preparing for their sons' first birthday. Gina Dewdney and her husband Craig were told by doctors that their naturally-conceived babies were a rare occurrence. "Being a mum is the best job I've ever had. It's the hardest job by far but I...love it," said Gina.

130.title: MSRTC employees protest outside Pawar's Mumbai house, throw shoes
130.article_body: Over 100 workers of Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC), who are seeking the corporation's merger with government, protested outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's residence in Mumbai on Friday. Some hurled shoes at his house. The workers blamed Pawar for not resolving their issues. "Some 120 MSRTC employees have died by suicide...These are not suicides, but murders," an employee said.

131.title: Elon Musk wears cowboy hat, drives oldest Tesla model at company event
131.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wore a cowboy hat, and sunglasses as he drove the oldest model Tesla ever built, at Tesla's Cyber Rodeo event on Thursday. The event marked the opening of the company's Giga Texas factory near Austin. Videos from the event showed the factory plant looking like a nightclub.

132.title: Video is distorted: Hindu mahant who threatened to rape Muslim women
132.article_body: Hindu mahant Bajrang Muni Das, who was seen in a video threatening Muslim women with rape in UP's Sitapur, claimed the video was distorted to implicate him. "If they'll harass our daughters, their daughters won't be safe too," he added. "During our Kalash Yatra, (Muslims) were prepared with sticks and stones to repeat Karauli-like incident," he alleged.

133.title: Mayank's batting has been affected since becoming PBKS' skipper: Sehwag
133.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said he's concerned about Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022, adding that his batting has been affected after becoming PBKS' skipper. "He was consistent last year with the bat. He should focus on his batting and forget about his captaincy when he walks out to bat," he added. Mayank has scored 32, 1, 4 so far.

134.title: 52-yr-old man falls while alighting from moving train in Kalyan, dies
134.article_body: A 52-year-old man died after he lost his balance while alighting from a moving train fell into the gap between the platform and the footboard at Kalyan railway station. The deceased identified as Pradip Bhangale was travelling from Bhusawal to Kalyan on Thursday when the incident took place. The incident was caught on the CCTV cameras installed at the station.

135.title: Video shows ACP slapping UP man 5 times, pulling hair for eve-teasing, harassing girl
135.article_body: A video showing ACP Tirpurari Pandey slapping a man accused of eve-teasing and harassing a girl student in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. Pandey can be seen slapping the man five times before pulling his hair on a busy road. He also warned the man of dire consequences if he continued to indulge in such crimes.

136.title: I am getting a lot of FOMO for not being there: Sam Curran on IPL 2022
136.article_body: England all-rounder Sam Curran, who withdrew from IPL mega auction as he's currently recovering from a back injury, said, "I'm getting a lot of FOMO for not being there and I want to tap my CSK mates." He added, "I hope CSK make it to the playoffs, but it's been a tough start...They need to turn it around pretty quickly."

137.title: Pregnant women face many judgements, but my baby is a miracle: Debina
137.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee, who welcomed her baby girl on April 3 with husband actor Gurmeet Choudhary, has called her child a miracle. "It was tough, emotionally, physically but everything is worth it when I see her face," she added. Debina further said that pregnant women face many judgements about what to wear, what to eat and how to exercise.

138.title: Heartening to see him grow: Ashneer shares update on Shark Tank contestant
138.article_body: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover took to Instagram to share a picture with Beyond Snack's Founder Manas. Speaking about Manas' business, Grover wrote, "Kerala Banana Chips was the first deal of Shark Tank Season 1 and it's heartening to see him grow 3x in scale profitably within 6 months!" Grover had invested in Beyond Snack.

139.title: Wasim Jaffer shares Hera Pheri's taxi scene to describe PBKS' selection problem
139.article_body: Wasim Jaffer shared the taxi scene from 'Hera Pheri' to describe PBKS' selection problem ahead of their clash against GT. "PBKS trying to fit Bairstow, Rabada, Livingstone, Rajapaksa and Odean Smith into the XI," he tweeted. In the scene, Om Puri's character Kharak Singh and his fellow villagers can be seen spilling out of the taxi while trying to fit.

140.title: Shahrukh could be X-factor for PBKS: Sehwag ahead of PBKS vs GT
140.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-GT in IPL 2022, Virender Sehwag said batter Shahrukh Khan could be the "X-factor" for PBKS if he bats "explosively" down the order. Meanwhile, Ajay Jadeja said pacer Kagiso Rabada is an important player. "If there's any weakness in Gujarat, it's their top-order that hasn't been exposed yet and that's why Rabada is key for Punjab," he added.

141.title: Covishield booster dose to be sold at discounted price of ₹600 plus tax: Poonawalla
141.article_body: Serum Institute of India will sell the precaution or booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield to private hospitals and vaccination centres at a "discounted price" of ₹600, SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said. This came after the government said all adults can take the booster dose from April 10. Covishield's price has been capped at ₹780 (including taxes) at private hospitals.

142.title: Locals can tell relatives they're alive: Ukraine Vice PM thanks Musk for Starlink
142.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has thanked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for Starlink satellite internet. He said that operation of electricity and mobile communications haven't been restored in the village of Ivankiv, but "Starlink came on time". Fedorov wrote, "Locals finally are able to tell relatives that they are alive. Thanks Elon Musk, your help is priceless for Ukraine."

143.title: CBI refuses to provide update through RTI in Sushant Singh Rajput case
143.article_body: The CBI has refused to provide update in reply to an RTI query seeking information in the Sushant Singh Rajput case. The late actor was found dead at his home in Mumbai's Bandra on June 14, 2020. The CBI has stated that the case is in the process of investigation and information about the progress may impede the investigation process.

144.title: B'luru Police arrest 7 of interstate gang for trafficking women abroad
144.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru Police's Women Protection Wing has arrested seven members of an interstate gang for trafficking women abroad. Preliminary investigation suggested that women from economically weaker sections of society were trafficked abroad after the gang members lured them into lucrative jobs abroad, police said. The victims were from Karnataka, Maharashtra and other states.

145.title: India need a finisher after Dhoni: Shastri on Karthik playing T20 WC 2022
145.article_body: Discussing Dinesh Karthik's potential selection in Team India's squad for the T20 World Cup 2022, Ravi Shastri said India need a finisher after MS Dhoni's retirement from international cricket. "Karthik has got the experience, he has got all the shots," added Shastri. Karthik has scored 90 runs in three IPL 2022 matches at a strike rate of 204.54.

146.title: Japan recognises Covaxin to facilitate travel between both nations
146.article_body: Hyderabad-based Bharat Biotech informed on Friday that its COVID-19 vaccine, Covaxin, has been recognised by Japan. "The government of Japan has included Bharat Biotech's Covaxin in the list of recognised vaccines to further facilitate travel from India to Japan starting April 10, 2022," the company tweeted. This development was also confirmed by Indian Embassy in Japan.

147.title: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse...' to release in India on May 6
147.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' from the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) is set to release in India on May 6. The upcoming film will release in multiple languages, including English, Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. The Sam Raimi directorial stars Benedict Cumberbatch, Rachel McAdams, Elizabeth Olsen and Chiwetel Ejiofor among others in pivotal roles.

148.title: Glamour isn't the reason why I joined films: Vidya on playing de-glam roles
148.article_body: Vidya Balan, while talking about playing deglamorised roles in her recently released films, said she hasn't joined films because of glamour. "I'm here to tell stories and I am fortunate to get stories, which are very different from each other, each time," the actress said. Vidya further said that she only selects such projects which appeal to her.

149.title: There will be comparisons: Sonu Sood on replacing Rannvijay in 'Roadies'
149.article_body: Sonu Sood has opened up about replacing Rannvijay Singha as the host in the upcoming season of the youth-based reality show 'Roadies'. "When you step into someone else's shoes, there will be comparisons," he said. Sonu added while the "DNA of the show" remains the same, the scale is larger and the journey is more real and raw this time.

150.title: I've been Warner's fan, enjoyed my first outing with him vs LSG: DC's Shaw
150.article_body: Talking about his experience of batting with DC opener David Warner against LSG, teammate Prithvi Shaw said it was great fun. "Once we form a good understanding, it'll be even better to bat with him," he added. "I've been a fan of the way he strikes the ball," he further said. Openers Shaw and Warner scored 61 and 4 respectively.

151.title: Gross tax collections surge to record ₹27.07 lakh crore in FY22
151.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that India's tax collections rose to a record high of ₹27.07 lakh crore between April 2021 and March 2022. He added that the revenue collection is almost ₹5 lakh crore above the Union Budget's estimates of ₹22.17 lakh crore. Direct tax collections in FY22 grew 49%, while indirect tax collections rose 30%.

152.title: Tom Hiddleston to star in and executive produce 'The White Darkness'
152.article_body: Actor Tom Hiddleston is set to star in and executive produce Apple's limited series 'The White Darkness'. According to Hollywood Reporter, the series is inspired by the true-life account of Lieutenant Colonel Henry Worsley, a former soldier who was deeply obsessed with adventure. The show will be penned by 'Pachinko' writer Soo Hugh who will also serve as executive producer.

153.title: Were confident about chase due to our batting depth: Bishnoi on LSG's win
153.article_body: Following LSG's six-wicket win against DC in IPL 2022, LSG spinner Ravi Bishnoi said he was confident about his side's batting depth while chasing the 150-run target. "The game got a little tight towards the end, but we still had Jason Holder and Krishnappa Gowtham to come," he added. LSG scored 155/4 in 19.4 overs.

154.title: Tribal women protest against cashew crop destruction in Andhra Pradesh
154.article_body: Tribal women staged a protest against alleged destruction of their cashew plantations by a mining company at Urlova village in Andhra Pradesh on Thursday. As a part of their symbolic protest, they imitated the act of suicide by hanging through a tree, saying they would be left with no choice but to end their lives if their plantations weren't saved.

155.title: Woman wins ₹75 cr lottery after accidentally buying wrong ticket in US
155.article_body: A woman won a $10 million (around ₹75 crore) lottery after she accidentally bought the wrong lottery ticket as a person bumped into her while she was trying to purchase a different ticket in California. As per the woman, the person bumped into her while she was selecting the ticket options and ended up buying a $30 ticket.

156.title: We were brilliant with the ball: KL Rahul on LSG's win over DC
156.article_body: After Lucknow Super Giants defeated Delhi Capitals by six wickets, LSG skipper KL Rahul said that his bowlers were "brilliant with the ball" and called the win a "complete team effort". "In the powerplay, we obviously need to go back and work on. But...we assessed things well after that and bowled better," Rahul said.

157.title: Microsoft says it disrupted Russian cyberattacks on Ukraine, EU, US
157.article_body: Microsoft has revealed that it disrupted hacking attempts by a group it nicknamed "Strontium", a Russian GRU-connected actor, aimed at breaking into Ukrainian, European Union, and American targets. The group was using seven internet domains as part of an effort to spy on Ukrainian institutions, government bodies and think tanks in the US and EU.

158.title: Show-cause notice issued to Pune hospital in kidney transplant case
158.article_body: A Pune-based hospital has received a show-cause notice over an alleged fraud during a kidney transplant procedure. The fraud reportedly occurred at Ruby Hall Clinic, where a woman allegedly posed as the wife of a man, who needed a transplant, and donated her kidney to a young woman. In return, the young woman's mother donated her kidney to the man.

159.title: Conor McGregor charged with 6 offences in driving arrest: Reports
159.article_body: UFC star Conor McGregor was charged with six offences for the dangerous driving case in which he was arrested in Dublin last month, reports said. McGregor reportedly faces two counts of dangerous driving and charges for driving without a licence, among others. Notably, the Irish fighter was released on bail and is due back in court on June 23.

160.title: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory: Sanjay Raut
160.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Friday alleged that BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory. "A presentation...has been made to the MHA...This has been going on for the last two months and I am saying this with full responsibility," he said, adding that Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray is also aware of this development.

161.title: Sex on the basis of genuine promise to marry that didn't fructify not rape: Delhi HC
161.article_body: A sexual relationship on a genuine promise of marriage that fails to fructify due to external circumstances is not rape, said Delhi High Court. The court was dealing with a matter in which a man and a woman were in a long-term relationship and got engaged but the marriage couldn't be solemnised. The relationship had ended on hostile terms.

162.title: Love the show and Sharma sisters: Priyanka praises Netflix's 'Bridgerton'
162.article_body: Priyanka Chopra praised Netflix drama series 'Bridgerton' for representing Indian culture on the show. "It's so wonderful to see desi representation on mainstream TV. It was...an anomaly when I started. Love the show and the Sharma sisters," Priyanka wrote on Instagram Stories. Based on Julia Quinn's series of novels, 'Bridgerton' features Simone Ashley and Charithra Chandran among others.

163.title: Activision Blizzard makes 1,100 game testers full-time employees
163.article_body: Activision Blizzard has announced it'll make around 1,100 of its temporary and contract quality assurance workers in the US full-time employees, starting July 1. These employees also will be eligible to participate in bonus plan and will have access to full company benefits. "This change follows a process that began last year" across Activision Publishing and Blizzard, a spokesperson said.

164.title: Researchers identify over 5,500 new RNA viruses in the ocean
164.article_body: Researchers have identified at least 5,500 new RNA virus species from 35,000 water samples from oceans across the globe. With this discovery, scientists have doubled the number of known RNA virus phyla from five to 10 to capture the diversity of the new findings. RNA viruses are known to cause several diseases in humans ranging from common flu to COVID-19.

165.title: My mother has a lung disease, please give our dues: Fired BharatPe employee to CEO
165.article_body: A former BharatPe admin in a post said his mother has a lung disease and is hospitalised and he hasn't received his reimbursement for a few months. "I'm the oldest employee of BharatPe working day and night. Why were we thrown out of the company without any reason," Dhananjay Kumar asked CEO Suhail Sameer. "Please give our dues...back," he added.

166.title: She loves her country India: UK finance minister Sunak as he defends wife Akshata's tax
166.article_body: UK Chancellor of Exchequer Rishi Sunak defended his India-born wife Akshata Murthy amid controversy over her non-domicile tax status. Stating that it wasn't fair to ask his wife to sever her ties with India, Sunak said, "She loves her country. Like I love mine." "Every single penny that she earns in the UK she pays UK taxes on," he added.

167.title: We wanted to keep wickets in hand: De Kock after LSG's win over DC
167.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants opener Quinton De Kock said that his side "wanted to keep wickets in hand" while chasing down a target of 150 runs against Delhi Capitals on Thursday. "It was a chaseable score, but we made sure not to get too ahead of ourselves," said De Kock after scoring 80 runs from 52 balls.

168.title: Twitter staffer said staff would be probed if they tweeted like Musk: Report
168.article_body: A Twitter employee said that the platform's employees would be subjected to an HR investigation if they tweeted like Tesla Founder Elon Musk, The Washington Post reported. According to a Slack message, the employee asked if board members are "held to the same standard" as employees. Several Twitter employees are reportedly worried about Musk's addition to the platform's board.

169.title: Fire breaks out at Industrial Development Corporation in Madhya Pradesh
169.article_body: A fire broke out at the Centre for Entrepreneurship Development Madhya Pradesh (CEDMAP) and Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation (MPIDC) in Bhopal on Friday morning. "At around 6:00 am, we received the information about a fire breaking out at the office...we immediately sent two tenders to control it," a fire station official said. No casualties were reported in the incident.

170.title: England launch their new T20I jersey, share pics
170.article_body: England have launched their new T20I jersey, which will be worn by the England men's and women's teams at the upcoming T20 World Cups. The kit has been designed to enhance performance and ease of movement with fabrics that Castore have used across the highest level of their sportswear, the England and Wales Cricket Board said.

171.title: Can't leave India without permission: Court to ex-Amnesty India chief
171.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday ordered the former Amnesty International India Board chair Aakar Patel to not leave India without permission until a decision is taken on CBI's plea challenging the order to quash look out circular issued against him. The court also put on hold Thursday's order which ordered CBI to tender a written apology to Patel.

172.title: 'Naagin 6' actor Tusharr Khanna buys Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh
172.article_body: Actor Tusharr Khanna, who stars in Ekta Kapoor-backed show 'Naagin 6', has bought an Audi A4 worth around ₹60 lakh. He took to Instagram to share pictures of his new car. "I feel fortunate to have got love and adulation for my work which made me capable enough to own this today, can't thank well-wishers enough," Tusharr said.

173.title: My kids enjoy watching my films but they're not my fans: Sanjay Dutt
173.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt in an interview has revealed that his children enjoy watching his films but they are not his fans. Sanjay has a daughter Trishala with his first wife late actress Richa Sharma and twins Shahraan and Iqra with his wife Maanayata. In an earlier interview, he had stated that his biopic 'Sanju' is his twins' all-time favourite film.

174.title: Serena Williams hints at comeback, says 'I've got to play Wimbledon first'
174.article_body: Twenty three-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams has hinted at making a comeback in this year's Wimbledon. When asked about her comeback by NFL player Aaron Rodgers, Serena said, "Wimbledon's before the US Open, I've got to play Wimbledon first."
