"We've been talking about my comeback...hyping me up and getting me ready for Wimbledon," the ex-world number one added.

175.title: Produce more children, else India will become 'Hindu-less': Yati Narsinghanand
175.article_body: Dasna Devi temple head priest Yati Narsinghanand, who is out on bail in Haridwar hate speech case, has urged Hindus to produce more children to prevent India from becoming "Hindu-less" in the coming decades. "Mathematical calculations state that a non-Hindu will become PM in 2029," he added. Narsinghanand called for a religious assembly in the Mathura-Govardhan region from August 12-14.

176.title: I promise fines for Muslims wearing headscarves: French presidential candidate
176.article_body: French presidential candidate Marine Le Pen on Thursday vowed to issue fines to Muslims who wear headscarves in public. "People will be given a fine in the same way that it is illegal to not wear your seat belt. It seems to me that the police are very much able to enforce this measure," she said.

177.title: A high-end designer told me 'That lehenga isn't for you': Yami
177.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has revealed certain high-end designers refuse to give their outfits because you are not so and so. She added she was once told 'No, that lehenga is not for you' and when she asked why, they said, 'No, just doesn't work with that designer'. "It was so mean...how can you make someone feel so bad?" Yami said.

178.title: BJP conspiring to make Mumbai a UT, I have proof: Sanjay Raut
178.article_body: BJP is conspiring to make Mumbai a Union Territory (UT), Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said. "A presentation about the same has been made to the Ministry of Home Affairs...Meetings have been held...funds are being collected," he claimed. "This has been going on for the last two months...I have the proof to substantiate what I am saying," Raut further said.

179.title: We're confident of what we've made: Shahid on not releasing Jersey on OTT
179.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about the decision to release 'Jersey' in theatres despite getting many offers from the OTT platforms, said, "We're confident of what we've made." "We made [it] with the intent of being viewed on...big screen," he added. "The emotionality of the film is such that it's best when viewed with a group of people," Shahid further said.

180.title: Rahul runs Cong round-the-clock, should be made party chief: Sharad Yadav
180.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Sharad Yadav backed Rahul Gandhi's name for the post of Congress President and said that he runs the party "round the clock".  "I think he should be made the party president. Only then can something big be done," Yadav said. Rahul Gandhi met Yadav today, weeks after he merged his LJD party with RJD.

181.title: Pink Floyd members reunite to release 1st song in 28 yrs to raise money for Ukraine
181.article_body: Pink Floyd members have reunited and are releasing their first song in almost 30 years to raise money for the people of Ukraine. The track 'Hey Hey Rise Up' features Pink Floyd members David Gilmour and Nick Mason along with Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk. This will be Pink Floyd's first original song since 1994's 'The Division Bell'.

182.title: UK targets 'lavish lifestyles' of Putin's daughters with new sanctions
182.article_body: The UK on Friday added Russian President Vladimir Putin's two daughters to its sanctions list in a bid to undermine the "lavish lifestyles of the Kremlin's inner circle" amid the Ukraine war. Katerina Tikhonova and Maria Vorontsova will be subjected to travel bans and asset freezes, the UK government said. Earlier, the US had imposed sanctions on Putin's daughters.

183.title: 2 suspected Pak spies give flat, iPhones to officials of US Prez's secret services
183.article_body: US has busted an alleged ISI cell of Pakistan trying to intrude into the American intelligence and security apparatus including Secret Service which is in charge of the security of the President. The suspected Pakistani spies, Arian Taherzadeh and Haider Ali, allegedly provided members of the US Secret Service with rent-free flats, iPhones, surveillance systems among other things

184.title: Regret that I didn't do it sooner: Khloe Kardashian on getting a nose job
184.article_body: Khloe Kardashian recently talked about getting a nose job on 'The Kardashians: An ABC News Special'. Khloe said she always wanted to get a nose job. "But it's in the middle of your face and it's scary to think about," she told host Robin Roberts. "My only regret is...I didn't do it sooner," she said while responding to a fan.

185.title: Rohit got frustrated against Umesh who is currently all over him: Hogg
185.article_body: Reacting to Rohit Sharma's 12-ball 3 in MI's IPL 2022 defeat against KKR, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Rohit got frustrated while facing Umesh Yadav who is currently "all over" the MI captain. Umesh dismissed Rohit for the fifth time in IPL history during the match. Umesh is IPL 2022's current Purple Cap holder with nine wickets in four matches.

186.title: Probably the find of IPL 2022 so far: Jaffer on LSG batter Badoni
186.article_body: Praising Ayush Badoni, Wasim Jaffer said the 22-year-old LSG batter is probably the find of IPL 2022 so far. Badoni came to bat with five needed off five balls, hitting a four and a six to help LSG win by six wickets against DC on Thursday. He added that Badoni looks like a "real talent" with the way he finished.

187.title: Sex racket operating in guise of spa busted in Pune; 3 women rescued
187.article_body: Police have busted a sex racket that was being operated in the guise of a massage and spa centre in Pune's Baner. After receiving a tip-off, police sent a decoy customer to the Divine Spa Centre and later carried out a raid at the centre. Subsequently, police rescued three women and arrested four persons, including the manager of the centre.

188.title: 'Dragon-like' sea creature captured by fisherman in Norway, pic goes viral
188.article_body: A Russian fisherman has shared a picture of a sea creature that resembles a baby dragon, captured by him from the Norwegian Sea. Roman Fedortsov caught the creature, whose pictures have gone viral online, while fishing off the coast of Tromsø in Norway. It has reportedly been identified as a chimaera, a cartilaginous fish also known as a 'ghost shark'.

189.title: I got shouted at so many times: Jacqueline recalls shooting for song in Aladin
189.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez recalled shooting for a song with Amitabh Bachchan in her debut film 'Aladin', and said, "I had no idea what I was doing, I got shouted at so many times on sets." "It was great to be thrown into that because it made me realise...if I want to be in this industry...I should...work my hardest," Jacqueline added.

190.title: GT may not consider Vijay Shankar after PBKS match: Aakash Chopra
190.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said GT may not consider Vijay Shankar for selection after their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. "He is neither picking wickets with the ball nor is he scoring runs with the bat and number three is an important slot," added Aakash. "At number three, if he gets an opportunity, this will be Shankar's last innings," stated Aakash.

191.title: 3 Shanghai officials sacked over COVID-19 response amid lockdown
191.article_body: Three local officials in Shanghai were sacked over a slack response to the COVID-19 outbreak in China's financial hub. An official notice didn't give details of the allegations against the officials but said their failure to fulfil their duties led to a "serious impact" on efforts to control the outbreak. Shanghai has placed its 26 million residents under lockdown.

192.title: MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack: Mohammad Kaif
192.article_body: Reacting to MI recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022, ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said MI will now realise the impact of a strong bowling attack. PBKS will take on GT today with pacer Mohammad Shami a part of the latter's squad. "With the new ball, there isn't a more dangerous bowler than Shami," added Kaif.

193.title: Don't give a crap about selection: Usman Khawaja on white-ball cricket
193.article_body: Australia batter Usman Khawaja said he has stopped giving a crap about selection for white-ball cricket, after being dropped from the white-ball squad despite averaging 50. "I was the second or third-highest run-scorer in that calendar year in white-ball cricket," added Khawaja. "If they want to pick me, they can pick. If they don't, my head's not...there," stated Khawaja.

194.title: Congress councillor held for beating up merchant in Kerala's Kochi
194.article_body: A Congress councillor, Tibin Devassy, was arrested for allegedly beating up a local merchant and forcibly taking away money from him in Kerala's Kochi, police said. The Island South councillor was arrested along with two other accused. The merchant alleged that Devassy and others kidnapped and beat him up, and forcibly made him transfer ₹2 lakh to their bank account.

195.title: Rare white kangaroo spotted in Australia, pics go viral
195.article_body: A rare white kangaroo was spotted in outback Queensland, Australia by a local. It was spotted by Nogo Station resident Sarah Kinnon. "I was just out with my husband, we were dropping some rams back to the paddock...It was pretty incredible, if you put a white sheet of paper next to it, that's how white it was," she said.

196.title: He won't be successful playing responsibly: Sehwag on Pant's 36-ball 39*
196.article_body: Reacting to DC captain Rishabh Pant's unbeaten 39 off 36 balls in the loss against LSG, Virender Sehwag said Pant won't be successful in IPL 2022 if he plays responsibly. "Pant should come and hit the ball and if he misses he goes back," added Sehwag. "Pant should look at his own videos...[which] can help him gain confidence," stated Sehwag.

197.title: BIAL, Amazon Web Services to collaborate for innovation centre at B'luru airport
197.article_body: The Bangalore International Airport Limited (BIAL) is working with Amazon Web Services (AWS), to establish a Joint Innovation Centre (JIC) at Kempegowda International Airport to drive the development and adoption of digital solutions in aviation. "This is the first JIC by AWS established outside China and its first JIC dedicated to advancing the aviation industry," BIAL said in a statement.

198.title: How have players bought for at least ₹10 crore in IPL mega auction performed so far?
198.article_body: MI's Ishan Kishan, the most expensive buy in IPL 2022 mega auction at ₹15.25 crore, has scored 149 runs so far. KKR captain Shreyas Iyer (₹12.25 crore) has scored 69 runs. PBKS' Liam Livingstone (₹11.5 crore) has scored 98 runs and has taken two wickets. DC's Shardul Thakur (₹10.75 crore) has conceded 118 runs in 11.4 overs with one wicket.

199.title: Cracked skull, almost died doing stunt for 'Armour of God': Jackie Chan
199.article_body: Jackie Chan revealed that he cracked his skull open and almost died performing a stunt for 1986 film 'Armour of God'. He said he was supposed to drink beer from a can before jumping into a tree but had to retake the scene and got drunk. When he leaped towards the tree, the branches snapped and he fell, Jackie added.

200.title: Pooja Bhatt to star in Sudhanshu Saria's 'Sanaa'
200.article_body: Pooja Bhatt is set to star in Sudhanshu Saria's women-oriented film 'Sanaa'. While talking about the film, Pooja said it is an "astonishingly perceptive" film which examines the lives of women "as we actually live it and not in a way the world thinks or wishes that we do". 'Sanaa' will also feature Radhika Madan, Shikha Talsania and Sohum Shah.

201.title: Man shot at while resisting robbery bid at Ghaziabad jewellery shop
201.article_body: A 37-year-old man was shot at by two armed men when he tried to resist their robbery attempt at his father's jewellery shop in Ghaziabad's Nehru Nagar area on Thursday. The victim, who's said to be critical, sustained a gunshot on the upper abdomen. Meanwhile, police have launched an investigation into the matter and are trying to trace the accused.

202.title: Zerodha CEO promises half month's pay to staff who lose weight, shares post
202.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath tweeted that employees with a BMI under 25 will get half a month's salary as a bonus. He added that while the average BMI of the team is 25.3, if it's under 24 by August, everyone will get another half a month's salary as a bonus. He also invited other companies to compete in this.

203.title: They don't exist for me: Divya Agarwal on trolls, negative comments
203.article_body: Actress Divya Agarwal while talking about being targeted by online trolls and negative comments, said, "I've...not seen them (trolls) in their real self. So for me, they don't exist." Further, Divya said that while she is grateful for the positive messages, she does not let them affect her as well. "I'm clear in balancing the positive and negative," she added.

204.title: Man kills labourer to frame girlfriend in Mumbai, arrested
204.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Ambernath Police for allegedly murdering an unknown labourer to frame his girlfriend of 15 years in the murder case. He suspected she was having an affair and wanted revenge. He even dropped her voter ID card on the body. After interrogating the woman, police learned she was not involved in the crime.

205.title: BharatPe CEO was drunk when he accused me of stealing money: Ashneer
205.article_body: Ashneer Grover said BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer must prove that he wasn't "under the influence of alcohol and drugs" when he accused Grover of stealing money from the company. "The said reply was put (on LinkedIn)...after a night of drunken debauchery by Suhail at BharatPe's offsite in Goa," Grover alleged. He demanded that Suhail be put on leave of absence.

206.title: 4 members of family including 2 children killed as AC explodes in Karnataka
206.article_body: A couple and their two children were killed due to an explosion in an air conditioner (AC) in a village in Karnataka's Vijayanagara district. A preliminary probe has revealed that the fire broke out after gas leaked from the AC vent, triggering an electric short circuit, which further led to an explosion. The entire house was also gutted in fire.

207.title: India's PV Sindhu, Kidambi Srikanth reach 2022 Korea Open semis
207.article_body: Indian shuttlers PV Sindhu and Kidambi Srikanth entered the 2022 Korea Open semi-finals in the women's singles and men's singles events respectively at Palma Stadium on Friday. Third seeded Sindhu beat seventh seeded Busanan Ongbamrungphan of Thailand 21-10, 21-16 in 44 minutes in the quarter-finals. Meanwhile, Kidambi Srikanth, seeded fifth, defeated Son Wanho 21-12, 18-21, 21-12 in 62 minutes.

208.title: It's a big deal AR Rahman approved Tiger Shroff's singing: Nadiadwala
208.article_body: Producer Sajid Nadiadwala has revealed that Tiger Shroff will be singing for AR Rahman by voicing the song 'Miss Hairan' in 'Heropanti 2'. Sajid further said it's a big deal that Rahman has approved him, adding that Tiger has been singing since school. "Knowing Tiger, I am sure he must have given a test for his singing too," he added.

209.title: BJP trying to take India in direction of a crisis similar to Sri Lanka: Gehlot
209.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has said that the BJP-led Centre is trying to take India in the direction of an economic crisis similar to Sri Lanka. "In Sri Lanka, people do not have food because there too the attention was diverted in the name of nationalism...The Modi government is trying to take India in the same direction," Gehlot said.

210.title: Largest annual rise of atmospheric methane seen since 1983: NOAA
210.article_body: Scientists observed the largest annual increase of atmospheric methane in 2021 since systematic measurements began in 1983, NOAA said. The increase last year was 17 parts per billion (ppb). Atmospheric methane levels averaged around 162% greater than pre-industrial levels in 2021. Scientists estimate global methane emissions in 2021 were 15% higher than in the 1984-2006 period.

211.title: All aged above 18 can take precaution dose against COVID-19 from April 10
211.article_body: The government on Friday said that everyone above the age of 18 years can take the precaution dose of COVID-19 vaccines from April 10, 2022, onward. The dose can be taken by those eligible at private vaccination centres, the Health Ministry said. It can be taken nine months after the administration of the second dose, it added.

212.title: Punjab Police books Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal
212.article_body: Punjab Police on Thursday booked Delhi BJP spokesperson Naveen Kumar Jindal for sharing a doctored video of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. In the video, Kejriwal is heard saying that he now takes money from corruption, along with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and other AAP MLAs. "After winning Punjab, Kejriwal thinks of Punjab Police as his father's grandson," Jindal tweeted.

213.title: 20 kids fall ill at Ghaziabad society; water contamination suspected
213.article_body: Nearly 20 children reportedly fell sick at Landcraft Golflinks, a residential society, in Ghaziabad on Wednesday, prompting health department officials to send their teams for checkups. Officials suspect consumption of contaminated water may have been the cause of the sickness as residents have alleged impurities in the society's water tank. Meanwhile, water samples have been sent for lab testing.

214.title: Told journalist to strip down to underwear to prevent suicide: MP policeman
214.article_body: After a picture of a journalist along with some other people stripped half-naked at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi went viral, police said it was done from a "safety point of view". The men were "kept in underwear...so that they did not die by suicide [using] their clothes", the SHO of Kotwali Police Station Manoj Soni said.

215.title: Video shows car turning turtle after jumping red light in Hyd
215.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday shared a video from Kompally, Alwal in Hyderabad, showing how jumping a red light at night is not safe. The video shows a speeding car hitting an auto after jumping the red light. After the crash, the car turned turtle. Police revealed that the auto driver and co-passenger suffered minor injuries.

216.title: At least 35 dead as 2 rockets hit train station used for evacuations in Ukraine
216.article_body: At least 35 people have died and around 100 others have been injured after two rockets hit a train station that was being used for civilian evacuations in eastern Ukrainian city of Kramatorsk. Earlier this month, Russia accused Ukraine of carrying out an airstrike on a fuel depot in the Russian city of Belgorod.

217.title: Completion of womanhood requires giving birth: HC on parole to man to procreate
217.article_body: Rajasthan High Court has granted a 15-day parole to a man currently serving a life sentence for murder on the grounds of want of progeny. Citing Hindu philosophy of four Purusharths, namely Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha, the court observed that "for a married woman, completion of womanhood requires giving birth to a child".

218.title: Himachal ministers, MLAs will now pay tax as 5-decade-old practice ends
218.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh cabinet has now decided to end the five-decade-old practice of the state bearing the income tax amount on salaries and allowances paid to its ministers and legislators. This decision comes after the Himachal Pradesh High Court sought response from the state government on a PIL challenging the provisions of Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly allowing such exemptions.

219.title: Over ₹10 cr collected by Pune railway division from passengers as penalty
219.article_body: The Pune railway division has collected ₹10.94 crore in fines from passengers for travelling without tickets from 2021-22. According to the Pune railway division, almost 2,17,633 passengers were penalised for not having a ticket. "If the passenger is unable to pay the fine, then they will be arrested by the railway police," said Manoj Jhawar, Pune railway division spokesperson.

220.title: Pic of horse travelling in a crowded train in West Bengal goes viral, probe ordered
220.article_body: A photo of a horse standing inside a crowded local train in West Bengal is being widely circulated on social media. While the Railways has ordered a probe into the incident, a fact-check of the photo has also been ordered. The horse was reportedly returning after taking part in a race in Baruipur with its owner.

221.title: 3 Adani Group firms get ₹15,400 crore investment from Abu Dhabi's IHC
221.article_body: Adani Enterprises announced on Friday that Abu Dhabi-based conglomerate International Holding Company PJSC (IHC) will invest $2 billion as primary capital in three Adani Group companies. IHC will invest ₹3,850 crore in Adani Green Energy, ₹3,850 crore in Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises. The boards of the companies have approved the transaction, Adani Enterprises said.

222.title: Sonu Sood granted Dubai Golden Visa, actor says 'I'm grateful'
222.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood has been granted the Dubai Golden Visa. "I'm incredibly honoured and grateful to...Dubai government for Golden Visa. Dubai has been one of my favourite destinations to visit. It's a dynamic place to thrive. I'm thankful to...authorities for the privilege," he said on receiving the Golden Visa. Boney Kapoor and his family also hold the Dubai Golden Visa.

223.title: Mahindra's deal to sell SsangYong to S Korea's Edison terminated
223.article_body: Mahindra & Mahindra's deal to sell its subsidiary SsangYong Motor to South Korean electric carmaker Edison Motors has been terminated. Edison's inability to deposit the bid amount led to the termination of the deal, Mahindra said in an exchange filing. Mahindra owned about 75% of SsangYong as of September-end 2021, which it bought in 2010.

224.title: Dealer who supplied gun to Northeast Delhi riot accused held
224.article_body: A firearms dealer was arrested by the Delhi Police for allegedly supplying a pistol to Shahrukh Khan, who is accused of rioting during the Northeast Delhi riots in 2020. "Babu Wasim had been absconding for over two years... Wasim has admitted to having supplied the said pistol... to Shahrukh Khan prior to the riots," Jasmeet Singh, DCP Special Cell, said.

225.title: Shark Tank India pitchers rejected by Ashneer Grover meet up, fans react
225.article_body: Shark Tank India pitchers Rohit Warrier and Niti Singhal, who were rejected by Ashneer Grover, recently met  and posted a video of their meeting on Instagram. "Weird pitches? Not so weird now!" Niti wrote in the caption. "Divided by Shark Tank united by Ashneer," a person commented while another comment read, "When two people have common enemies, they become friends."

226.title: Veteran actress Sripriya's daughter Sneha gets married to Anmol Sharma
226.article_body: Sneha Sethupathi, daughter of actors Rajkumar Sethupathi and Sripriya, got married to Anmol Sharma in Chennai. A few pictures from their wedding have also surfaced online. According to reports, the pre-wedding festivities started on April 4, and the duo tied the knot on April 6. The wedding was attended by R Sarath Kumar, Radikaa Sarathkumar, Khushbu Sundar and others.

227.title: EU President, diplomatic chief travelling to Kyiv amid conflict
227.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said she is travelling to Ukraine's capital Kyiv, along with the bloc's diplomatic chief Josep Borrell and Slovak PM Eduard Heger. She is the most senior Western leader to go to Kyiv since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. She will hold talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during the visit.

228.title: Elderly man, 3 sons rape his 17-yr-old foster daughter in Chennai, booked
228.article_body: Police booked a 65-year-old man along with his three sons, aged 39, 29 and 24 for allegedly raping his 17-year-old foster daughter. The girl's biological parents had sold her to a couple when she was one month old. Her youngest foster brother sexually abused her when she was 15, later, the other accused also started raping her repeatedly, police said.

229.title: Sec 144 imposed in Assam's Sivasagar as measure to avert anti-social activities
229.article_body: Amid concerns over the law and order situation, the district administration has imposed Section 144 in Assam's Sivasagar, along with a night curfew along the state border with Nagaland, to prevent anti-social activities. The restrictions will remain enforced for the next 60 days or until further notice. Officials have also prohibited pillion-riding on two-wheeler vehicles, with certain exemptions.

230.title: Teen electrocuted to death while taking selfie atop train engine in MP
230.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was electrocuted to death while taking a selfie atop a stationary train engine at Chhatarpur Railway Station in Madhya Pradesh, an official said. "The victim tried to grab an overhead high tension electricity line, which was charged," Railway Protection Force (RPF) inspector Jitendra Kumar said. A few youths manhandled the station master following the incident.

231.title: Woman fearing safety pretends to order pizza on 999 in UK, gets man arrested
231.article_body: A man was arrested after a woman fearing for her safety called 999 and pretended to order a pizza while they were on a bus in the UK. Sensing that the woman was in danger, the police asked her yes or no questions. She was then rescued after the police traced her location using tracking data and arrested the man.

232.title: Always a question mark on Shubman's power-hitting, strike rate: Jaffer
232.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said there is always a question mark on GT opener Shubman Gill's power-hitting and strike rate, but termed his 46-ball 84 against DC at a strike rate of 182.60 as outstanding. Talking about Vijay Shankar, Jaffer stated it's a matter of concern that Shankar got the chance to bat at the number three position for GT.

233.title: Don't buy into phrases like '2 bodies 1 life' for married couples: Vidya Balan
233.article_body: Talking about gender imbalance in society, Vidya Balan said, "When a couple gets married...people use sentences like '2 bodies 1 life' and I keep saying, 'Listen...please don't buy into that because do jism aur aadmi ki jaan...humari jaan rehti nahi hai'." "There's a change in the way we women are looking at ourselves...what we want from our lives," added Vidya.

234.title: Police officers can't use battalion personnel as domestic help: Assam govt
234.article_body: No Assam Police officer will be allowed to use any battalion personnel as domestic help, the Assam government said. The state government added that if any officer is found using battalion personnel for personal, household works then they will have to pay their salary, the government won't pay. "We want to abolish this system," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

235.title: Ukraine forces now in control of Sumy region bordering Russia: Governor
235.article_body: Ukrainian forces are now in control of the entire northeast region of Sumy along the border with Russia, its governor claimed. "The area is free of orcs," Dmytro Zhyvytsky said, on Facebook, referring to invading Russian troops. However, he warned residents that "the region isn't safe as there are many areas that have been mined and are still not cleared".

236.title: Paytm-backer Elevation Capital raises $670 mn, its largest India fund
236.article_body: Early-stage investor Elevation Capital, which has backed Swiggy and Paytm, among other Indian startups, has closed its latest India-dedicated fund at $670 million, its largest-ever. Elevation said it would look to deploy the fresh capital over a three-year time frame. It will invest in sectors such as consumer internet, fintech, SaaS, apart from emerging themes such as Web3 and cryptocurrency.

237.title: Ajmer bans loudspeakers at religious places to curb noise pollution
237.article_body: Ajmer district administration banned the use of loudspeakers in public and religious places with effect from April 7 to curb noise pollution. Violators who don't abide by the order will be booked under IPC section 188 (Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), the notice read. The administration had earlier banned religious flags and banners in the district.

238.title: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine: UK
238.article_body: Russian forces have fully withdrawn from northern Ukraine to Belarus and Russia, UK's Ministry of Defence said on Friday. At least some of these Russian forces will be transferred to East Ukraine to fight in the Donbas, it added. "Russian shelling of cities in the east and south continues," the ministry further said.

239.title: Over 5 B'luru schools get bomb threats via email; bomb squads conduct searches
239.article_body: Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Friday said that more than five schools in the city have received bomb threats through emails. There is a drill and as per that the bomb squads have reached the spots and are conducting checks, Pant added. As per reports, no explosive material has been found at any of the schools so far.

240.title: Train runs over 3 youths trying to make Instagram reel in Tamil Nadu
240.article_body: Three youths died after a passenger train ran over them near Tamil Nadu's Chengalpattu when they were trying to make an Instagram reel. Police said one of the deceased is a college student, while another is a daily wage worker. "We are going through their social media profiles to check if they had uploaded similar videos earlier," an officer said.

241.title: 4th pillar of democracy dismantled: Rahul on journalists stripped in MP
241.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi criticised the Madhya Pradesh government after photos of journalists forced to strip to their undergarments at a police station in Sidhi went viral on social media. "The fourth pillar of democracy ‍was dismantled in the lockup! Either sit in the lap of the government and sing their praises or go to jail," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

242.title: I started shivering when Dhoni asked me to bowl: Harbhajan on 2011 WC semi vs Pakistan
242.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has revealed that he started shivering when MS Dhoni asked him to bowl in the second spell in the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan. "They were batting really well at that stage. He asked me to bowl after the drinks break. I did not want to show people the pressure," Harbhajan added.

243.title: Kashmiri Pandits stopped from attending event on 'The Kashmir Files' in Pune
243.article_body: Two Kashmiri Pandit community members in Pune were allegedly stopped by police from attending an event on 'The Kashmir Files', said Rohit Kachroo, national coordinator of 'India 4 Kashmir'. The members wanted to ask some questions related to Kashmiri Pandit issues, Kachroo added. "Our purpose was to not let any law and order situation arise," a senior police inspector said.

244.title: Singapore jails Australian for throwing wine bottle, killing Muslim man
244.article_body: A Singapore court sentenced an Australian man to five-and-a-half years in prison for throwing a wine bottle and killing a 73-year-old Muslim man in 2019, saying it was an act of "religious hostility toward Muslims". Andrew Gosling had pleaded guilty to throwing the bottle at a Muslim family group as he was "angry" over ISIS attacks in Bali and Melbourne.

245.title: Ad in Delhi reads 'Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-'; women panel chief posts video
245.article_body: A digital advertisement board at a store in Delhi was allegedly hacked after which obscene advertisements were flashed on it. Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal shared a video showing the LED board running the advertisement of a spa, that read, "Russian@20000/-, p**sy@2000/-." "Shameful...Spas are not at all scared by MCD and Delhi Police," Maliwal wrote.

246.title: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi tests COVID-19 +ve, Asia trip delayed
246.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has postponed a planned congressional trip to Asia after she tested positive for COVID-19 on Thursday. On Wednesday, the 82-year-old was seen at a White House event with US President Joe Biden while not wearing a mask. The White House said that the President has tested negative for COVID-19 after coming into contact with Pelosi.

247.title: RBI won't do anything that goes against sanctions on Russia: Governor Das
247.article_body: During a press conference following the RBI monetary policy announcement, Governor Shaktikanta Das said that RBI "will not do anything that goes against the sanctions" on Russia. Das added, "If and when some rupee-ruble trade mechanism is worked out, you will get to know. We are sensitive to the sanctions." Earlier, India bought oil from Russia at discounted rates.

248.title: Twitter to test letting users 'unmention' themselves in tweets
248.article_body: Twitter will be testing a way to help users "unmention" themselves in tweets. It's doing so to help users "protect" their "peace" and remove themselves from conversations they don't want to be a part of. The experimental offering is limited to the web for now. Twitter has described the test as global but "small".

249.title: IT dept attaches 41 properties linked to Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav
249.article_body: Income Tax department has attached 41 properties linked to Shiv Sena leader and Chairman of the Standing Committee of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Yashwant Jadhav, ANI reported. He is accused of tax evasion, the report added. The attached properties include 31 flats in Byculla's Bilkhadi Chamber Building, a flat worth ₹5 crore in Bandra and Hotel Crown Imperial in Byculla.

250.title: I can't romance Alia Bhatt: Sanjay Dutt on embracing his age
250.article_body: Sanjay Dutt has said he believes in moving with the times and embracing his age. "I can't romance Alia Bhatt," the 62-year-old actor said, adding, "You've to come to terms with it...You've got to move on." Sanjay further said he admires the younger generation of actors, like Alia and her partner Ranbir Kapoor, with whom he'll be seen in 'Shamshera'.

251.title: Liquorice may help with cancer treatment: Study
251.article_body: Liquorice, a popular candy, may help in preventing and treating certain types of cancers, a study stated. Researchers have found that a substance, glycyrrhizin, derived from the liquorice plant, Glycyrrhiza glabra has great anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer properties. They are studying liquorice further to determine if it could be used to prevent or stop the growth of prostate cancer.

252.title: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane refuses to file bond of good behaviour to Mumbai Police
252.article_body: BJP MLA Nitesh Rane, booked in a case over his statements about Disha Salian's death case investigation, refused to furnish a bond of good behaviour with Mumbai Police and termed the show cause notice "bad in law". Assistant Commissioner of Police Shailendra Dhivar had issued the notice to the BJP MLA asking him to execute a good behaviour bond.

253.title: US Army suspends SpaceX's application to expand Texas launch site
253.article_body: The US Army Corps of Engineers has suspended SpaceX's application for an expansion of its South Texas launch site after it failed to provide requested information. "Without the requested information, the permit process cannot continue," the Army Corps said. The information that officials have sought includes any impacts associated with SpaceX's plans and data on endangered or threatened species.

254.title: Senate confirms Jackson as first Black woman on US Supreme Court
254.article_body: The US Senate on Thursday confirmed Ketanji Brown Jackson to the Supreme Court, making her the first-ever Black female justice. The 51-year-old was confirmed by a 53-47 vote. US President Joe Biden called the confirmation "a historic moment for our nation". "We have taken another step toward making our highest court reflect the diversity of America," Biden said.

255.title: Faith steers us through stormy seas: RBI Governor quotes Gandhi in note on economy
255.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das concluded his monetary policy speech by quoting Mahatma Gandhi. "It is faith that steers us through stormy seas, faith that moves mountains and faith that jumps across the ocean," he said. Earlier, he said Russia-Ukraine war poses an "overwhelming challenge" and the RBI is "prepared to defend the Indian economy with all instruments at its command".

256.title: Navi Mumbai man denied pre-arrest bail for hiding homosexuality from wife
256.article_body: A court has rejected the pre-arrest bail application of a 32-year-old man from Navi Mumbai, who allegedly cheated his wife by hiding his homosexuality. The woman claimed that her husband allegedly forged a job offer letter, showing ₹14 lakh salary per annum, to impress her and also forced one of his gay partners to accompany them to their honeymoon.

257.title: MP govt planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in degree courses: CM Chouhan
257.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday said the state government is planning to teach Bhagavad Gita in the second year of the degree course. "I have read Gita since childhood," Chouhan said, adding it teaches us to work without thinking about results. "This knowledge enables people to keep on working which...brings encouraging and constructive results," he said.

258.title: Delhi auto drivers call for a strike over CNG price hikes
258.article_body: Sections of auto drivers in Delhi have called for a strike on Friday over CNG price hikes, ANI reported. Associations of auto, cab and taxi drivers will hold protests at Jantar Mantar. "If we ask for ₹10-20 more from passengers, they get off the auto," an auto driver said. CNG price has increased by over ₹9 in seven days.

259.title: Mumbai's Haji Ali, Bandra-Worli sea-link at risk of submergence by 2050: Report
259.article_body: Around 998 buildings and 24 km of road length in Mumbai including Haji Ali dargah, Western Express Highway, Bandra-Worli sea-link, Queen's Necklace on Marine drive are at risk of submergence by 2050, as per the RMSI report. In addition to Mumbai, places in Kochi, Mangalore, Chennai, Visakhapatnam, and Thiruvananthapuram are also at risk of submergence, the report said.

260.title: Baba Ramdev rings opening bell as Ruchi Soya FPO shares list at 30% premium
260.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Patanjali CEO Acharya Balkrishna were seen ringing the opening bell at the BSE as Ruchi Soya's follow-on public offering shares listed on Friday. The shares opened at ₹855 on NSE and at ₹850 on BSE, giving over 30% premium to subscribers who were allotted shares. Before the FPO, Ramdev-led Patanjali owned 98.9% in Ruchi Soya.

261.title: People no longer come to Goa for drugs: Newly appointed Goa DGP
261.article_body: Goa's Director General of Police (DGP) Jaspal Singh, who took charge on Thursday, said people don't visit the coastal state for drugs any more, but for its beaches, culture and cuisine. "We don't want people to remember Goa for drugs," Singh said during his first press conference. He further said that various agencies need to coordinate to control drug cartels.

262.title: T'gana Chief Justice felicitates Hyd home guard for commitment towards duty
262.article_body: Chief Justice of Telangana High Court Satish Chandra Sharma on Friday felicitated Home Guard Ashraf Ali of Abids Traffic Police Station. The Chief Justice used to regularly watch Ali en route to the high court and appreciated his sense of commitment towards duty, Hyderabad Police said. Thus, while going to the High Court today, he felicitated Ali with a bouquet.

263.title: Rishabh Pant fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against LSG
263.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) on Thursday. As it was DC's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Pant was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated DC by six wickets.

264.title: Singer Avril Lavigne gets engaged to boyfriend Mod Sun, shares proposal pics
264.article_body: Singer Avril Lavigne got engaged to her boyfriend Mod Sun in Paris. Avril took to Instagram to share pictures and revealed that the engagement happened on March 27. Commenting on Avril's post, Mod Sun wrote, "I love you so much...Forever and ever my angel." "It was the most perfect, romantic proposal I could ever ask for," Avril told 'People' magazine.

265.title: It is very, very important for every MI player to be desperate: Rohit
265.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said it is very, very important for every MI player to be slightly desperate, with the franchise recently recording their third defeat in a row in IPL 2022. "We seriously cannot be blaming individuals," added Rohit. "We need to seize on the little opportunities during the game and get momentum," stated Rohit.

266.title: What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims: US politician
266.article_body: US politician Ilhan Omar took to Twitter and wrote, "Why has Biden Administration been so reluctant to criticise Modi's government on human rights?" "What will it take US to criticise Modi govt's actions against Muslims?" she said in a video. "What does Modi need to do to [Muslims] before we will stop considering them a partner in peace?" she added.

267.title: Elon Musk to address Twitter staff in an 'ask me anything' session
267.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter's largest shareholder, will be addressing Twitter employees at an 'ask me anything' session. "Many of you have had different types of questions about...Musk and I want to welcome you to ask those questions to him," Twitter CEO reportedly told staff in an email. The employees have reportedly raised concerns about Musk joining the board.

268.title: No restrictions imposed on news media in Jammu & Kashmir: Centre
268.article_body: Minister of Information and Broadcasting, Anurag Thakur, has said that the Centre has not imposed any restrictions on news media in Jammu & Kashmir.  "Home Ministry has informed that there have been no instances of any harassment to the media persons by the authorities since 2017," Thakur said while responding to a question in Rajya Sabha on Thursday.

269.title: End of BJP in K'taka, says ex-PM Deve Gowda amid loudspeaker issue
269.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Deve Gowda has said that implementing the policy of banning the use of loudspeakers by religious sites will be an "end of BJP" in Karnataka. His comments came after the Bengaluru Police issued notices to 301 mosques, temples, churches, restaurants and other establishments to use their loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels.

270.title: Delhi to get 19 more schools by the end of current financial year: Officials
270.article_body: Delhi will get 19 more schools with state-of-the-art facilities by the end of the current financial year and pre-construction work at several of these schools has started, officials said. The construction of two new schools in Southwest Delhi's Molarband and Gadda Colony area is nearing completion, officials added. Of the 19 schools, 11 will be Schools of Specialised Excellence (SoSE).

271.title: Earlier I could meet only 70% population, now I can meet 100%: Supriyo
271.article_body: TMC candidate for the Ballygunge Assembly by-poll, Babul Supriyo, has said that when he was in BJP, he could meet only "70% of the population" but now he is "free to meet 100%". "A communal stamp was imposed over my image. But it's not true," he said. Notably, West Bengal Imams Association has opposed Supriyo's candidature and called him "communal".

272.title: 66-year-old woman dies after son stabs her multiple times in Gurugram
272.article_body: A 66-year-old woman died after she was allegedly stabbed multiple times by her son in Gurugram's Shivpuri in the New Colony area on Thursday, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to give dinner to her son who lived in a separate house nearby. The exact motive for the murder is yet to be ascertained, police added.

273.title: Cardless cash withdrawal to be available at all banks, ATMs via UPI soon: RBI
273.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "At present, the facility of cardless cash withdrawal through ATMs is limited only to a few banks." "It is now proposed to make cardless cash withdrawal facility available across all banks and ATM networks using the UPI," Das added. This would help prevent frauds such as card cloning, he stated.

274.title: HC orders CBI probe into TMC leader's murder that preceded Birbhum violence
274.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Friday ordered the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) to probe TMC panchayat leader Bhadu Sheikh's murder, which allegedly led to violence in which nine persons were burnt to death in West Bengal's Birbhum. Earlier on March 25, the High Court had ordered a CBI investigation into the killings of the nine people in Bogtui village.

275.title: World's largest diamond miner & Russian shipbuilder sanctioned by US
275.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on two Russian state-owned firms, Alrosa and United Shipbuilding Corp (USC), over Ukraine war. The USC "constructed...warships that...bombarded Ukraine", while Alrosa's proceeds helped "finance...Russian government's war", US State Department said. Alrosa, the world's largest diamond mining firm, accounts for 90% of Russia's diamond mining capacity, as per US Treasury.

276.title: Remove or place Ganesha idols 'respectfully' in Qutub complex: NMA to ASI
276.article_body: National Monuments Authority (NMA) Chairman Tarun Vijay said that the Ganesha idols placed "disrespectfully" in the Qutub Minar complex should either be removed or installed "respectfully". The former Rajya Sabha MP said that he had raised the issue with the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) more than a year ago but is yet to receive a response to his letter.

277.title: Kuldeep knows he will play for DC no matter how he bowls: Sehwag
277.article_body: Virender Sehwag said chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav knows he will be a part of DC's lineup, no matter how he bowls for the franchise in matches. "DC don't have any other spinner to replace him," added Sehwag. Kuldeep has picked six wickets in three IPL 2022 matches so far and is DC's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing edition.

278.title: Jr NTR's next with Koratala Siva to be made on a budget of ₹300 cr: Report
278.article_body: Actor Jr NTR's upcoming film with filmmaker Koratala Siva will reportedly be made on a budget of ₹300 crore. According to the report, the yet-untitled project will also feature Alia Bhatt. It'll be shot over a period of six to seven months at multiple locations, the report said. Jr NTR and Alia recently shared screen space in SS Rajamouli's 'RRR'.

279.title: Made sure nobody stands at square leg when Pant's batting in nets: Kaif
279.article_body: Ex-DC assistant coach Mohammad Kaif said they would make sure nobody stands at square leg when Rishabh Pant was batting in the nets, as Pant's bat would go towards square leg if he lost control. "We used to move to the off-side knowing he would play fewer strokes...there," added Kaif. "Pant is one of my favourite players," stated Kaif.

280.title: Shah Rukh Khan pens handwritten letter to 'Pathaan' assistant director, pic surfaces
280.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan penned a handwritten letter to Abhishek Anil Tiwari, assistant director of his upcoming film 'Pathaan'. A picture of the letter has surfaced online, wherein Shah Rukh calls Abhishek "a gem". "I love the fact that you love your drinks. Have a good life in cinema...I will miss you lots," a part of the letter read.

281.title: Russia-Ukraine war could impede India's economic recovery: RBI Governor
281.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Russia-Ukraine "war could potentially impede the economic recovery" and projected India's real GDP growth at 7.2% for 2022-23. Das added that financial market volatility induced by monetary policy normalisation in advanced economies and renewed COVID-19 infections in some countries "pose downside risks to the outlook".

282.title: He made the slow surface appear simple: De Kock on Shaw's 34-ball 61
282.article_body: LSG opener Quinton De Kock said DC batter Prithvi Shaw made the slow surface during their IPL 2022 match appear simple, scoring 61 runs off 34 balls at a strike rate of 179.41. Shaw's knock comprised nine fours and two sixes. De Kock was the match's top run-getter, scoring 80 runs off 52 balls at a strike rate of 153.84.

283.title: Russia bans Australian, New Zealand PMs from entering country
283.article_body: Russia has imposed entry bans on Australian PM Scott Morrison and New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern after they imposed sanctions on Moscow over the Ukraine war. Russian Foreign Ministry accused Australia and New Zealand of "hostile actions" towards Russia. In total, Russia on Thursday barred 228 Australian lawmakers and government members and 130 New Zealand citizens from entering the country.

284.title: Ashneer writes to BharatPe, seeks action against CEO after 'Ashneer stole money' remark
284.article_body: Ashneer Grover has written to the BharatPe board saying that CEO Suhail Sameer should "immediately be put on leave of absence" and Chairman Rajnish Kumar should "immediately resign". Earlier, Suhail in response to a comment by Ashneer's sister on LinkedIn said, "Your brother stole all the money...Very little left to pay salaries." Ashneer also demanded a written apology from Suhail.

285.title: Girl's body found in car parked inside Asaram's ashram; was missing since April 5
285.article_body: The body of a 13-year-old girl, who was missing since April 5, was recovered from a car parked inside self-styled godman and rape convict Asaram Bapu's ashram in Uttar Pradesh. The police have sent the body for a post-mortem. A person from the ashram has been taken into custody by the police for questioning in the matter.

286.title: Impose Article 356, we will win by bigger margin: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee
286.article_body: TMC's National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee claimed that his party will come back to power by winning 250 seats if Centre imposes Article 356 in Bengal. This statement comes after opposition parties have been calling for imposition of Article 356 in West Bengal after the Birbhum incident. "Many more leaders want to leave BJP and join our party," he added.

287.title: As heatwave continues in Rajasthan, Jalore records 45.2°C
287.article_body: At 45.2°C, Rajasthan's Jalore recorded the state's highest temperature on Thursday amid the heatwave, India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. A maximum temperature between 41°C-43°C was recorded in several parts of Rajasthan on Thursday. For the next five days, IMD has issued a yellow alert for heatwaves and an orange alert for severe heat waves in some parts of the state.

288.title: A cricketer born on 8-4-63 scored 8,463 runs in Test cricket
288.article_body: In a unique coincidence, former England captain Alec Stewart, who was born on 8-4-63 (April 8, 1963), smashed 8,463 runs in his Test career. Stewart is the most capped Test wicketkeeper for England, playing 133 matches from 1990 to 2003. Stewart also played 170 ODIs for England, scoring 4,677 runs including four hundreds and 28 fifties.

289.title: Didn't expect appreciation from the US: Rajamouli on 'RRR'
289.article_body: Director SS Rajamouli during an event opened up on his film, 'RRR', being appreciated by the western media and said that he didn't expect the US to praise the movie. "New York Times, too, has written about our film. The western audience, particularly in...US, is liking [it]. This is the kind of thing I take to my heart," Rajamouli added.

290.title: Incidents of cybercrime, fraud recorded fivefold jump between 2018 & 2021: Govt
290.article_body: Incidents of cybercrime and fraud recorded a fivefold jump between 2018 and 2021, the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY) informed a parliamentary panel. As per government data, the number of cybercrime incidents rose from 2,08,456 in 2018 to 14,02,809 in 2021. As many as 2,12,485 such cases were recorded in the first two months of 2022.

291.title: RBI hikes retail inflation projection to 5.7% in 2022-23
291.article_body: While announcing the RBI monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das said retail inflation is projected to be higher at 5.7% in 2022-23 amid a spike in crude oil prices due to Russia-Ukraine tensions. Retail inflation, which is measured by Consumer Price Index, is expected to be at 6.3%, 5.8%, 5.4%, and 5.1% in the first, second, third and fourth quarter, respectively.

292.title: Man kills labourer to implicate girlfriend in case in Thane, arrested
292.article_body: A 40-year-old man was arrested by Thane police for allegedly killing an unknown labourer to implicate his girlfriend in the murder case. According to police, the accused, Waman Shinde, was in judicial custody and was out on bail for few days. He suspected his girlfriend of having an affair and murdered the labourer to take revenge on her, police added.

293.title: Tesla to make a futuristic-looking dedicated robotaxi: Elon Musk
293.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said the firm will expand its "Full Self-Driving" beta software to all North American subscribers this year and will come up with a "dedicated robotaxi". He said the robotaxi is "going to look quite futuristic-looking". He made the announcement at a party to mark the opening of Tesla's $1.1 billion factory in Texas.

294.title: Ex-Maha Home Min Deshmukh 'mastermind' in money laundering case: ED
294.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh is the "mastermind" in the money laundering case registered against him, Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday said while opposing his bail plea in Bombay High Court. He had misused his position a lot and is hiding many important things, it added. "If granted bail, he can go out...tamper with the evidence," ED claimed.

295.title: Kerala lifts all COVID-19 restrictions; use of face masks to continue
295.article_body: In view of the current COVID-19 situation, the Kerala government on Thursday announced that all restrictions imposed in the state will be lifted with immediate effect. All advisories issued by the Centre's Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, including the use of face masks and hand hygiene, will continue to be in force, the state government added in a release.

296.title: RTI is not admission of government, answer depends on question posed: SC
296.article_body: Right to Information (RTI) is not an admission of the government as the answer provided depends on the question posed, Supreme Court said. "It's always misleading. What question is posed, depending upon that... answer is given. That's been our broad experience," it added. SC was hearing pleas over GST exemption for services provided by private tour operators to Haj pilgrims.

297.title: Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting match-winning six goes viral
297.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni's Virat Kohli-like celebration after hitting a match-winning six against DC has gone viral. Badoni was seen pointing towards his name on the jersey before pumping his fist. Kohli had celebrated in such a fashion when his 94*(50) helped India chase down a target of 208 in a T20I against West Indies in Hyderabad in 2019.

298.title: Over 3 crore houses constructed for the poor under Awas Yojana: PM Modi
298.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced the completion of 3 crore 'pucca' houses for the poor under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana on Friday. "These houses...have...become a symbol of women empowerment today," PM Modi tweeted. These houses built in both rural and urban areas of the country are equipped with basic facilities like electricity, toilet, water and gas supply.

299.title: RBI cuts GDP growth projection to 7.2% for 2022-23 from 7.8% earlier
299.article_body: While announcing RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das projected India's GDP growth at 7.2% in 2022-23, as against the previous projection of 7.8%. RBI expects GDP to grow at 16% in the first quarter of 2022-23, 6.2% in the second quarter, 4.1% in the third quarter and 4% in fourth quarter. Growth projections assume crude oil at $100/barrel, Das said.

300.title: Drew Barrymore dances to 'Chura Ke Dil Mera' with Lilly Singh, lip syncs to it
300.article_body: YouTuber Lilly Singh took to Instagram to share a video of herself and actress Drew Barrymore dancing to 'Chura Ke Dil Mera'. In the video, Drew can also be seen lip-syncing to a part of the song. "Didn't she nail this?! Ugh. A queen," Lilly wrote. "This is everything...Best thing I've seen in a long time," actress Freida Pinto commented.

301.title: Babar Azam overtakes Sachin Tendulkar in all-time ODI batting rankings
301.article_body: Pakistan captain Babar Azam has overtaken Sachin Tendulkar in all-time ODI batting rankings. Babar is now placed 15th on the list, having attained 891 rating points. Sachin is 16th on the list with 887 rating points. Ex-West Indies captain Viv Richards leads the all-time rankings with 935 rating points. Virat Kohli is sixth on the list with 911 rating points.

302.title: Hindu mahant threatens to kidnap Muslim women and publicly rape them in UP
302.article_body: A video showing a Hindu mahant threatening to kidnap Muslim women from their homes and publicly rape them has surfaced on social media. The mahant said this while addressing a gathering outside a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district. Police said a senior officer is investigating the matter and that action will be taken on the basis of facts.

303.title: Odisha journalist chained to hospital bed after arrest in assault case
303.article_body: A 50-year-old journalist was allegedly chained to a hospital bed on Thursday following his arrest in an assault case in Odisha's Balasore. A two-wheeler hit his motorcycle on Monday and an inspector said that an assault case was registered against him. The journalist accused the inspector of holding a grudge against him over the publication of a piece of news.

304.title: Allu Arjun to start shooting for 'Pushpa 2' in July: Report
304.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun will reportedly start shooting for the sequel to 'Pushpa: The Rise - Part 1' in July. The makers are planning to shoot some important scenes in the first schedule, the report stated. Srikanth Vissa, who penned the dialogues for the first part, is working on the second part as well. 'Pushpa 2' will be directed by Sukumar.

305.title: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 4%, reverse repo rate hiked to 3.50%
305.article_body: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Friday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and increased reverse repo rate to 3.50% amid geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The repo rate was left unchanged during last MPC meeting in February 2022. This is the 11th consecutive time that the MPC has kept repo rate unchanged.

306.title: Like film where you're more confused after 3.5 hours: Joy on Pant's calls
306.article_body: Talking about DC captain Rishabh Pant's decisions in the loss against LSG, ex-KKR director Joy Bhattacharjya said it reminded him of an Andrei Tarkovsky film where you end up getting more confused after three-and-a-half hours. "It was an absolutely perplexing game. There are a lot of tricks that have been missed...It's the strangest of bowling cards," Joy added.

307.title: People from different states should speak in Hindi instead of English: Shah
307.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that people from different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, instead of English. "Now the time has come to make the official language an important part of the unity of the country," he added. Shah, however, clarified that Hindi should be accepted as an alternative to English and not local languages.

308.title: UP govt to develop mobile app for modern education in madrassas
308.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has decided to develop a mobile application for imparting modern education to the students of madrassas. Further, biographies of great persons and freedom fighters would also be included in the curriculum. According to Minister of State for Minority Welfare, Danish Azad Ansari, the move will help in instilling the feeling of 'Rashtrabhakti' among the students.

309.title: Registration for Amarnath Yatra 2022 to start from April 11
309.article_body: Registration for Amarnath Yatra for the year 2022 will begin on April 11, said Nitishwar Kumar, CEO, Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board. "The pilgrims can...register online through the website and mobile app of the Shrine Board," he added. The offline registrations can be made across 446 branches of J&K bank, PNB, Yes Bank and 100 branches of SBI, Kumar informed.

310.title: China's Tencent cut CEO's pay by 25% in 2021, President's by 24%
310.article_body: China's Tencent Founder and CEO Pony Ma's pay dropped by 25% to $6.9 million in 2021, the firm's annual report showed. President Martin Lau's total pay dropped 24% to $50.7 million from $67.2 million the year before, including a 32% decline in his bonus. The firm also disclosed that the highest-paid individuals were not among the directors or senior executives.

311.title: From an AC technician to an expert trainer, meet Mobin: Urban Company
311.article_body: The latest episode of Urban Company Impact features AC technician Mobin, introduced as a man with responsibilities and ambition. He talks about his 18-year-long struggle, moving cities for work, living a lonely life until he joined Urban Company in Kolkata. The episode shows how he found a place valuing his skills and helping him grow to become an expert trainer.

312.title: 2 killed, 8 injured in terror attack at Israeli bar; US condemns shooting
312.article_body: At least two people were killed and eight others were injured after a man opened fire into a crowded bar in Israel's Tel Aviv on Thursday. Condemning the attack, Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said, "Security forces are in pursuit of the terrorist." "Wherever the terrorist is, we'll get to him," Bennett added. The US also condemned the "senseless" terrorist attack.

313.title: Shah Rukh Khan's look from upcoming film leaked online
313.article_body: A picture of Shah Rukh Khan from the set of a film has surfaced online, revealing his look from the upcoming project. In the picture, the actor can be seen sitting in a vehicle, with his face covered with a cloth. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So it's confirmed that SRK has begun the shoot of Atlee's 'Lion'."

314.title: Doubt if states will be able to pay salaries: Mamata Banerjee
314.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee once again criticised Centre's economic policies and said, "Country's economic situation is getting bad to worse, I doubt if states will be able to pay salaries in coming days." "The rise in fuel prices is affecting the lives of people. I request Centre to control fuel prices and temporarily stop collecting toll tax," she added.

315.title: Indian rat snake rescued from waste unit fire in Noida
315.article_body: A five-foot-long Indian rat snake, which was stranded in the aftermath of a fire in a waste collection unit in Sector-63, Noida was rescued, an NGO said. As per Wildlife SOS officials, the snake sustained minor burns on its mouth and body and is undergoing treatment. The Indian rat snake plays a very important role in the food chain.

316.title: Situation in Ukraine's Borodyanka more dreadful than Bucha: Zelenskyy
316.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Thursday said that the situation in the town of Borodyanka was "significantly more dreadful" than in nearby Bucha. There are "even more victims" of Russian troops in Borodyanka, Zelenskyy added. According to local officials, more than 300 people were killed by Russian forces in Bucha town, and around 50 of them were executed.

317.title: It's no secret that I am Sharad Pawar's man: Sena MP Sanjay Raut
317.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that it is no secret that he is NCP chief Sharad Pawar's man. "While I've been in the Sena, my relations with Pawar are close...BJP is upset because of this," he added. This comes after Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of Raut in connection with a land scam case.

318.title: Price of lemons increases to ₹10 each in Hyd; vendors say 'nobody buying'
318.article_body: Amid rising lemon prices across the country over the past week, the price of lemons has increased to ₹10 each in Hyderabad. "Earlier, we used to purchase a whole lemon sack for ₹700, which now costs ₹3,500," a vegetable vendor said. "I bought a dozen of lemons for ₹120. Earlier, I used to purchase them for ₹20," a customer said.

319.title: India reports 1,109 new COVID-19 cases, active cases in country at 11,492
319.article_body: India has reported 1,109 new COVID-19 cases and 43 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,492, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,573. The country saw 1,213 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

320.title: PayPal Co-founder calls Warren Buffett a 'sociopathic grandpa' & Bitcoin's top enemy
320.article_body: At a Bitcoin conference, PayPal Co-founder Peter Thiel said Berkshire Hathaway Chairman Warren Buffett tops an "enemies list" of people who are trying to stop the cryptocurrency. He referred to billionaire Buffett as "the sociopathic grandpa from Omaha". Thiel also said Buffett, JP Morgan's Jamie Dimon and BlackRock's Larry Fink were a "gerontocracy" opposed to a "revolutionary" crypto movement.

321.title: FIR against Ludhiana residents who dumped waste at councillor’s office
321.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the residents of Ludhiana's Manjit Nagar, who dumped waste at the office of ward number 47 councillor Priya Kaira, following inaction over clogged sewer lines. They have been booked for rioting, theft, and trespass after Kaira's personal assistant filed a complaint against them, claiming they created a ruckus and damaged furniture at the office.

322.title: A cricketer hung me from 15th floor balcony after getting drunk in 2013: Chahal
322.article_body: Recalling an incident from IPL 2013 when he used to represent MI, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal revealed that during a get-together in Bengaluru, a cricketer took him outside and hung him from the balcony after getting drunk. "I was on the 15th floor. Many people came and handled it. I kind of fainted. I made a narrow escape," he added.

323.title: Friend of Pak PM's wife, whose pic went viral, saw wealth jump during his tenure
323.article_body: The wealth of Pakistan PM Imran Khan's wife Bushra Bibi's friend Farah Khan, whose picture with a $90,000 bag went viral, reportedly grew from PKR231 million in 2017 to PKR971 million in 2021. During first three years of Khan's tenure, Farah bought properties in different cities and made investments worth millions. Farah reportedly fled to Dubai amid allegations of corruption.

324.title: Burglars who stole ₹2 cr from B'luru house held; police checking cash source
324.article_body: Two burglars looking to steal ₹2 lakh to pay debt, hit pay dirt when they got ₹2 crore at a house they burgled in Bengaluru. The police nabbed both the burglars and recovered ₹1.76 crore in cash and gold ornaments worth ₹12 lakh. The police have written to the tax department to get clarity on whether it was unaccounted cash.

325.title: Musk's Twitter investment is tiny, it's meaningless: Tesla shareholder
325.article_body: One of Tesla's largest shareholders Ron Baron, CEO of Baron Capital, said Tesla CEO Elon Musk's stake in Twitter and his accompanying board seat are not significant. "I think it's meaningless. It's a tiny investment...He has Tesla which is worth a trillion [and] on the way to being worth $3 or $4 trillion," Baron added.

326.title: Fraudster gifts new phone to film distributor in Mumbai, cheats him of ₹2.9 lakh
326.article_body: A Bollywood film distributor was allegedly cheated of ₹2.9 lakh by a fraudster who posed as a bank employee and offered him an international credit card. The fraudster told the victim that he is unable to send a link as the latter has an iPhone. To facilitate the fraud, he sent him a new phone and extorted money.

327.title: BMC to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent uprooting of plants
327.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install tree tubs with wheels to prevent trees from being uprooted during any construction work. Under Phase-I of the project, 500 such tubs will be placed in open spaces and footpaths in the Worli area. According to a BMC official, the initiative will help in increasing the green cover of the city.

328.title: Play frontal role in war against gangsters: Punjab CM tells senior police officers
328.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has asked the Commissioners of Police and Senior Superintendents of Police to play a frontal role in the war against gangsters by personally conducting operations and interrogations. "You will be personally held responsible for any breach of law and order in your jurisdiction as you are accountable under the law," the CM further said.

329.title: Nigerian sentenced to 10 years in prison for smuggling heroin into Mohali
329.article_body: A 39-year-old Nigerian man was sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for smuggling heroin into Mohali. The local court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on him. Based on a tip-off that a man will be entering Mohali with heroin, police had stopped and checked him on suspicion in 2018. They'd recovered 260 grams of heroin from him.

330.title: Curfew extended in Rajasthan's Karauli till April 10 after communal clashes
330.article_body: The curfew imposed in Rajasthan's Karauli, where communal clashes broke out, has been extended till 12 am on April 10, the administration has announced. The curfew will be relaxed between 9 am and 12 pm daily for general stores, dairies, fuel stations and others to function, it added. Mobile internet services continue to remain suspended in Karauli.

331.title: Why was DC's Anrich Nortje barred from bowling after 14 deliveries vs LSG?
331.article_body: DC fast bowler Anrich Nortje was barred from bowling after delivering 14 balls against LSG in IPL 2022 on Thursday night. The 28-year-old pacer, featuring in his first IPL 2022 match, was taken off the attack after bowling two beamers. He bowled his first over-the-waist ball in the 14th over and the second beamer in the 16th over.

332.title: Forest dept gives nod to Delhi Metro to fell over 3,000 trees
332.article_body: Forest Department has given its nod to the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) to fell or transplant 2,940 trees in the North Forest Division and 450 trees in the South Forest Division. In the North division, 1,963 are to be transplanted, and 977 trees will be felled. In the South Division, 299 will be transplanted, and 151 will be felled.

333.title: BharatPe CEO apologises for salary remark; firm says all employees got March salary
333.article_body: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer apologised for his remarks in which he indicted that Ashneer Grover "stole money" from the company and little is left to pay salaries. An employee had raised the matter of sacking of admin staff and non-payment of salaries, to which Ashneer and Suhail had responded. Meanwhile, BharatPe clarified that all employees were given their March salary.

334.title: Major fire reported at industrial unit with chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad
334.article_body: A major fire was reported at an industrial unit with a chemical storage in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi area on Thursday night. Large plastic drums storing industrial chemicals aggravated the fire into a major blaze, a fire official said, adding that some explosions were heard initially. The nature of the chemicals and details of the damages are yet to be ascertained.

335.title: Will continue to fight till last ball: Pak PM as he faces ouster vote
335.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan said he would "continue to fight for Pakistan till the last ball" as the country's Supreme Court ordered that a no-confidence vote against him will take place on April 9. The court on Thursday set aside the National Assembly Deputy Speaker's ruling to dismiss the vote seeking to oust Khan. Pakistan's opposition hailed the court's decision.

336.title: 39-yr-old Hyderabad man beaten to death for misbehaving with woman
336.article_body: A 39-year-old man was beaten to death in Hyderabad for allegedly misbehaving with a woman. According to police, the man misbehaved with the woman near her house on Wednesday, following which her husband, along with some local residents, beat him with sticks. Subsequently, the man went to his house, but his family members found him dead that night, police added.

337.title: Cargo plane splits in two after emergency landing at Costa Rica airport
337.article_body: A DHL cargo plane slid off the runway and broke in half after it made an emergency landing at an airport in Costa Rica. DHL said the crew was unharmed and that one member was undergoing a medical review as a precaution. The fire department said the plane had detected a failure in the hydraulic system.

338.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to send drivers without helmets for counselling sessions
338.article_body: In a special drive against drivers found not wearing helmets, Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to impose fines through e-challans, suspend licence of such drivers for three months and also send them for two-hour-long counselling sessions. "In the last one month, we have fined over 75,000 bikers for driving without helmets," DCP Traffic (Headquarter and Central) Raj Tilak Roshan said.

339.title: 5-yr-old boy killed, grandfather injured as bike hits scooter in Delhi
339.article_body: A five-year-old boy was killed and his 58-year-old grandfather got injured after a bike hit their scooter in Southwest Delhi on Wednesday, police said. "The grandfather was...on his scooter with his two grandsons," Additional DCP Vikram Singh added. "We apprehended a 15-year-old boy...He said he was with his friend [on the bike]...were on their way home...they escaped afterwards," Singh stated.

340.title: B'luru Police ask temples, mosques to comply with noise pollution rules
340.article_body: Bengaluru Police have asked temples and mosques to comply with noise pollution rules and use the loudspeakers within the permissible decibel levels. Over 300 notices have been issued to establishments, including mosques, temples and churches, over the same, City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Reportedly, police have also started seizing mics from places that allegedly defied the orders.

341.title: 22-yr-old woman delivers baby boy at Delhi Metro Station platform
341.article_body: A 22-year-old woman on Thursday delivered a baby boy at Anand Vihar Metro Station in Delhi, officials said. The woman was waiting for the metro when she reportedly developed labour pain. A female CISF personnel and other women passengers arranged for a sheet and helped in the delivery of the baby boy at the platform, a senior CISF officer added.

342.title: Badoni finishes chase with a six in last over as LSG beat DC to win 3 matches in a row
342.article_body: LSG's 22-year-old batter Ayush Badoni finished the run chase with a six in the last over as his team defeated DC to register their third straight win in IPL 2022. DC had put up a total of 149/3 in their 20 overs, with Prithvi Shaw scoring 61(34). Quinton De Kock top-scored for LSG with 80(52).

343.title: Liverpool's Klopp insists clash with Man City will not decide PL title
343.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp insists that this weekend's match against Premier League leaders Manchester City will not decide the title in their favour. "If we win against City, which is already difficult enough, I think no one would think, 'that's it, decided', because of the quality of the opponent," he said. Liverpool are currently one point behind Manchester City.

344.title: Maxwel Cornet scores to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in PL
344.article_body: Maxwel Cornet scored in the 85th minute to help Burnley beat Everton 3-2 in the Premier League. The defeat means Everton are one point above the relegation zone in 17th place on the Premier League table. Burnley are one point behind Everton. Brazilian international Richarlison scored twice from the penalty spot to give Everton a 2-1 lead at half-time.

345.title: Faf Du Plessis has earned respect in RCB change room: Glenn Maxwell
345.article_body: RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said that Faf Du Plessis has earned the respect of everyone in RCB change room. "Not only does he lead by example, with his actions, but he also performs really well," he said. Maxwell added, "To have a guy of his quality and caper up the top of the order is something that’s great for RCB."

346.title: Patrick Mouratoglou to coach former world no. 1 Simona Halep full-time
346.article_body: Frenchman Patrick Mouratoglou, long-time coach of Serena Williams, on Thursday said he will coach former world number one Simona Halep full-time. "In the last eight months, I realised how much I missed coaching. It is the passion of my life, and I still feel like I have so much to give," he said. Halep is a two-time Grand Slam champion.

347.title: Video shows Kerala student, born without legs, being carried by friends
347.article_body: A video shot by a wedding photographer shows a student in Kerala's Kollam district being carried by his friends inside the college campus as he was born without legs. The student, Alif Mohammed, is pursuing BCom. The photographer Jagath Thulaseedharan said, "For everyone inside the college, this is a common sight as Alif is always carried around by...his friends."

348.title: We still have plenty to learn: Mercedes boss Wolff ahead of Aus GP
348.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes still has plenty to learn ahead of the Australian Grand Prix this weekend. "There won't be a magic fix for the next race weekend, but we're pushing to steadily bring gains over the upcoming races, to hopefully move us closer to the front of the pack," he said referring to Ferrari and Red Bull.

349.title: Digital Rupee won't eliminate cryptos in India: CEA Nageswaran
349.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said the introduction of a Central Bank Digital Currency, or Digital Rupee, won't lead to the elimination of cryptos and stablecoins as they satisfy different objectives.
