"Objective for cryptos to emerge is...tax evasion, money laundering and speculation...Therefore, they have to be tackled separately with other regulatory instruments," he said.

350.title: Want to seek EU membership separately from North Macedonia: Albania
350.article_body: Albania will approach European Union (EU) to enquire if it can pursue its membership bid separately from North Macedonia, Albanian PM Edi Rama said on Thursday. North Macedonia, which faces a veto by Bulgaria amid disputes between them, had been grouped with Albania by EU in their accession bid. "Albania cannot wait...until two neighbours resolve their quarrel," Rama added.

351.title: Why did India abstain from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC?
351.article_body: India abstained from UNGA vote to suspend Russia from UNHRC following the killings in Ukraine. In its explanation, India said, "If India has chosen any side, it is the side of peace and it is for an immediate end to violence." India added, "Recent reports of civilian killings in Bucha are deeply disturbing...We support the call for an independent investigation."

352.title: Whistleblower alleges wrongdoing at Invesco Mutual Fund: Reports
352.article_body: A whistleblower has filed complaints with SEBI and US SEC about alleged mismanagement by Invesco Mutual Fund's fixed income team, Moneycontrol reported. Invesco is accused of having the same person holding the positions of Chief Investment Officer and Advisor to its offshore portfolio management services. The fixed income team is accused of executing trades on behalf of Invesco's offshore funds.

353.title: Pic of dresses draped on crosses near Canada site where kids were found buried wins award
353.article_body: An image of dresses draped on crosses near Kamloops in Canada, where remains of 215 children were found last year, won the 2022 World Press Photo of the Year award. The image was captured by Amber Bracken, who's the fifth female World Press Photo of the Year winner. It commemorates the children who died at the Kamloops Indian Residential School.

354.title: South films have been made in Hindi & vice versa for last 70-80 yrs: Abhishek
354.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said that he has worked in remakes of South Indian films in the past. "South films have been made in Hindi and Hindi films have been made in the South for the last 70 to 80 years," he added. Abhishek's upcoming film will be a remake of the Tamil film 'Oththa Seruppu Size 7'.

355.title: Which are the most expensive overs in IPL history?
355.article_body: RCB all-rounder Harshal Patel and ex-KTK pacer Prasanth Parameswaran hold the record for bowling the joint-most expensive over in IPL history, conceding 37 runs each. Harshal conceded 37 runs against CSK in IPL 2021, while Parameswaran conceded 37 runs against RCB in IPL 2011. They are followed by MI all-rounder Daniel Sams, who conceded 35 runs against KKR on Wednesday.

356.title: Ukrainian PM thanks UN for humanitarian aid, asks for more support
356.article_body: After meeting UN aid chief Martin Griffiths on Thursday, Ukrainian PM Denys Shmyhal took to Twitter and thanked the UN for the humanitarian aid it received since Russia's invasion. PM Shmyhal further "stressed the need to increase support and unite efforts to provide targeted financial assistance to Ukrainians suffering from Russian aggression". The Ukraine-Russia war entered its 43rd day today.

357.title: Belarus must be involved in negotiations over Ukraine crisis: Lukashenko
357.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko said on Thursday that his country must be involved in negotiations to resolve the conflict in Ukraine, adding that Belarus was "dragged' into it by the West. Lukashenko added that he expects to hold talks with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin soon. Notably, several Western countries have included Belarus in sanctions against Russia over the conflict.

358.title: 2 men die after entering manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat
358.article_body: Two men who had entered a 10-feet-deep manhole to find gold particles in Gujarat's Surat died of asphyxiation on Thursday.The manhole was in an area where several small jewellery manufacturing units are located. A local resident said, "Since there are several jewellery manufacturing units in this area, gold particles get washed into the sewer."

359.title: Which nations supported Russia in resolution seeking its suspension from UNHRC?
359.article_body: As many as 24 nations voted against the draft resolution to suspend Russia from UN Human Rights Council over Ukraine war. While UNGA passed the resolution with 93 countries in its favour, the nations that voted against included China, Belarus, Burundi, Algeria, Eritrea, Congo, Syria, Kazakhstan and Iran among others. Meanwhile, over 50 nations, including India, abstained from voting.

360.title: India & US to hold 2+2 dialogue in Washington on April 11
360.article_body: The MEA on Thursday informed that India and US will hold 2+2 dialogue on April 11 in Washington. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will hold talks with US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin and Secretary of State Anthony Blinken. "The...dialogue will...provide an opportunity to exchange views about important regional and global developments," MEA said.

361.title: Was no chance of getting wedding licence at that hour: Kourtney
361.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, speaking about her marriage with Travis Barker not being legal, has said that they were unable to get the licence at that hour. "It was 2 am and they were like 'it opens at 8 o'clock'," she added. Kourtney and Travis got married at a chapel in Las Vegas hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

362.title: UNGA suspends Russia from UNHRC; India abstains from voting
362.article_body: The UN General Assembly (UNGA) on Thursday suspended Russia from the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC). India abstained from the UN General Assembly vote. As many as 93 countries voted in the favour of the draft resolution, 24 countries voted against it and 58 countries abstained.

363.title: Pakistan PM Imran Khan loses court case, faces no-trust vote on Saturday
363.article_body: Pakistan Supreme Court has termed National Assembly Deputy Speaker's decision to dismiss the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan as "unconstitutional". The Supreme Court has restored the National Assembly and ordered Speaker to call for session on April 9 to organise no-confidence vote. On Sunday, the no-trust motion against Khan's government was dismissed by Deputy Speaker Qasim Suri.

364.title: Enjoyed myself while gaining 15 kgs for 'Dasvi': Nimrat Kaur
364.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur, in an episode of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', revealed that she gained 15 kgs for her film 'Dasvi'. "I had six months in hand so I put on weight at my own pace. I ate lots and enjoyed myself," she further said. The actress added director Tushar Jalota wanted her to look different from her previous characters.

365.title: Armenia & Azerbaijan agree to peace talks over Nagorno-Karabakh
365.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan have agreed to peace talks over disputed territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, following a meeting between the countries' leaders on Wednesday. The countries will set up bilateral border commission by April end, according to a statement by Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan. The move comes amid reports of recent clashes in region, two years after large-scale conflict broke out there.

366.title: No comments: India on political crisis in Imran Khan-led Pakistan govt
366.article_body: On being asked about political turmoil in Pakistan arising after Imran Khan's decision to dissolve country's National Assembly, India's External Affairs Ministry spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said, "I have no comments." "We are watching developments but don't comment on such internal matters," he added. Pakistan's Deputy Speaker had rejected the no-confidence vote against Imran Khan.

367.title: Can do Telugu film & get seen around world: Mahesh on not doing Hindi films
367.article_body: Mahesh Babu has said, "I don't need to do Hindi films...can just do a Telugu film and it'll get seen all over the world." "You'd want to be in a position to do (only) a Telugu film," he added. This comes after Telugu films like 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'RRR' collected over ₹300 crore and ₹200 crore, respectively, across India.

368.title: Former world no. 5 Tsonga to retire after French Open
368.article_body: Former world number five Jo-Wilfried Tsonga on Wednesday announced he will retire after the French Open this year. It will be the 15th time the Frenchman will play the French Open. "I've always set myself high goals to try and get what I can. For me, this will be the opportunity to do it one last time," the 36-year-old said.

369.title: Matteo Berrettini, Dominic Thiem withdraw from Monte Carlo Masters
369.article_body: World number six Matteo Berrettini and former US Open champion Dominic Thiem have pulled out of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Thiem will miss the upcoming event as he continues his recovery after having tested positive for COVID-19 last week. Berrettini meanwhile misses out due to a minor operation he had on his playing hand last week.

370.title: India, Australia name officers' exchange programme after CDS Rawat
370.article_body: Indian and Australian governments have announced an Australia-India Young Defence Officers' Exchange Programme in memory of late CDS General Bipin Rawat, who was killed in a helicopter crash in December. The programme will be named after General Rawat, Australia's High Commissioner to India Barry O'Farrell said. General Rawat took over as CDS after serving as Army chief for three years.

371.title: Jr NTR says 'SS Rajamouli should make RRR 2', director replies
371.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has said that director SS Rajamouli should make a sequel to their recently released film 'RRR'. "There needs to be a conclusion to this also," Jr NTR stated. Ram Charan added, "We all will be delighted again if Rajamouli sir thinks of RRR 2." To this, Rajamouli replied, "For me, it would be a great pleasure."

372.title: BJP's Kirron Kher meets SP's Jaya Bachchan in Parliament, shares pic
372.article_body: BJP MP from Chandigarh Kirron Kher on Thursday met Rajya Sabha MP from Samajwadi Party Jaya Bachchan in the Parliament. Sharing the picture on social media, Kher wrote, "Wonderful to meet Jaya after so long in Parliament." The Budget Session of the Parliament ended today, a day ahead of the schedule. It had started on January 31.

373.title: Austria expels 4 Russian diplomats for breach of norms
373.article_body: Austria on Thursday announced expulsion of four Russian diplomats for engaging in activities incompatible with their diplomatic status. Three envoys working at Russian Embassy in Vienna and one staffer working at Russian Consulate General in Salzburg have been asked to leave Austria by April 12. Austria joins France and Italy, among other European countries, which recently expelled Russian envoys.

374.title: 2 US personnel injured in an apparent rocket attack in Syria: Officials
374.article_body: Two US personnel were injured after an apparent rocket struck the US Air Force base overnight in Syria, officials said on Thursday. According to a report, the US-led forces also returned fire after the rockets were launched from an area where Iran-backed militias have a presence. However, no one has claimed responsibility for the attack so far.

375.title: When I put on weight, people said I am pregnant: Nargis Fakhri
375.article_body: Speaking about facing body shaming, Nargis Fakhri said, "When I first came to India, I was too skinny, so everyone was like 'You need to put on weight'." "Later I gained about 50 pounds, so they posted I was pregnant, which I thought was not funny, but also very funny. I think...my feelings got hurt," she added.

376.title: Tharoor clarifies after pic with Supriya Sule goes viral, says 'she was speaking softly'
376.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has issued a clarification after a picture of him chatting with Supriya Sule during Farooq Abdullah's speech in Parliament went viral. "She was asking me a policy question because she was about to speak next. She was speaking softly so as not to disturb Farooq Sahib, so I leaned over to hear her," he tweeted.

377.title: 429 interns worked with MEA in last 5 years: S Jaishankar
377.article_body: As many as 429 interns have worked in the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) over the last five years, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar told the Rajya Sabha on Thursday. He added, "The MEA has been engaging interns for a decade, reflecting an intent to expand the foreign policy discourse in the country and tap into talent beyond the government."

378.title: No pressure on India over trade with Russia: MEA
378.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), when asked about western pressure over trade with Russia, said, "Don't think there's any such pressure. Talks of sanctions going on but it's not on the entire trade." The MEA added, "Our focus is to maintain and stabilise our established economic relations with Russia."

379.title: Opposition front not 'enough' to take on BJP: Sisodia
379.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday said that the formation of an Opposition front "would not be enough to take on the BJP". People have realised BJP's methods of winning elections, which they do by diverting attention from the main issues but do nothing for the masses after forming the government, he said.

380.title: Ayodhya Airport must be ready along with Ram Temple: Yogi to officials
380.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Thursday told officials that the Maryada Purushottam Shri Ram International Airport in Ayodhya should be functional "by the time Ram Lalla moves to his new temple next year". He said air connectivity will help connect history with the present time and make Ayodhya the "most beautiful city in the world".

381.title: Onus on Pakistan to create terror-free environment for trade: Govt
381.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said India is committed to addressing issues with Pakistan and asserted that the onus of maintaining a terror and hostility-free environment for such an engagement is on Pakistan. Minister of State for External Affairs V Muraleedharan said, "India desires normal neighbourly relations." Pakistan suspended trade with India in August 2019, Muraleedharan added.

382.title: Why did we elect govt?: SC on plea to deport illegal immigrants
382.article_body: While hearing a plea filed by BJP leader and advocate Ashwini Upadhyay seeking directions for government to identify and detain all illegal immigrants within a year, CJI NV Ramana on Thursday expressed concern over SC being burdened by politically sensitive matters. "If we have to take up all your PILs, then why did we elect the government," he asked.

383.title: Number of global COVID-19 cases, deaths fell last week: WHO
383.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths fell during the week of March 28 through April 3. Over nine million cases were reported across the six WHO regions last week, a 16% decrease compared to the week before. Global COVID-19 deaths also dropped by 43% with over 26,000 new deaths reported.

384.title: Voters don’t accept Babul Supriyo: CPM candidate on Bengal bypolls
384.article_body: Ahead of West Bengal Assembly bypolls, CPM's candidate from Ballygunge constituency, Saira Shah Halim, said on Wednesday that people aren't willing to vote for Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Babul Supriyo. Halim, who is also actor Naseeruddin Shah's niece, added that Supriyo is seen as "anti-minority" and isn't accepted by 'Bangali Bhadralok' (Bengali intellectuals). Supriyo resigned from BJP in 2021.

385.title: 7 heat-related deaths reported in last 2 weeks in Maharashtra
385.article_body: Maharashtra reported seven heat-related deaths and 59 heatstroke cases in the past fortnight, as per the state health department. Three deaths were reported from Jalgaon, two from Nagpur and one each from Akola and Osmanabad. With the maximum temperature settling at 44°C, Akola has been the hottest city in the country for the last three days.

386.title: Making contingency plans for possible chemical assaults in Ukraine: WHO
386.article_body: WHO's European head Hans Kluge on Thursday said that it's preparing for possible "chemical assaults" in Ukraine. Kluge said, "WHO is considering all scenarios and making contingencies for different situations that could afflict the people of Ukraine, from the continued treatment of mass casualties to chemical assaults." There are no assurances that the war will not get worse, Kluge added.

387.title: US will boycott G20 meeting if Russia is allowed to attend: Yellen
387.article_body: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said US will boycott "a number of G20 meetings" if Russian officials are allowed to attend. "President Biden has made it clear, and I certainly agree with him, that it cannot be business as usual for Russia in any of the financial institutions," Yellen said. She added Russia should be expelled from the Group of 20.

388.title: 'Goondagardi' not good for country: Kejriwal on BJP after attack
388.article_body: Criticising BJP for the attack on his house, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that "goondagardi is not good for the country". "The protesters were people from the BJP. They came to my house and climbed the walls. My elderly parents were there. We weren't there at home," he further added.

389.title: Pic shows YouTuber, journalists stripped to their underwear at a police station in MP
389.article_body: A picture of journalists and YouTuber Kanishk Tiwari stripped to their underwear at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi has surfaced online. Tiwari said they had gone to the station to cover the arrest of theatre artist Neeraj Kunder who was arrested for allegedly making indecent remarks about BJP MLA Kedarnath Shukla. "We were beaten, abused," Tiwari added.

390.title: Half of critics who wrote me off now ask me for work as writers: John
390.article_body: Actor John Abraham said half of the critics who wrote him off after every film during his initial acting days come to him for work as writers. "They say...'We're very sorry'," he stated. John added, "Now when they come to me for work...I try and help them and say...'You could have been good critics, you're failed writers but no problem'."

391.title: CBI makes first arrests in Birbhum violence case, nabs 4 from Mumbai
391.article_body: Days after at least nine people were killed in West Bengal's Birbhum, the CBI on Thursday arrested four people in Mumbai in connection with the case. These are the first arrests made by the CBI since it took over the case last month. Miscreants had allegedly set around 10-12 houses on fire in Birbhum's Bogtui village on March 21.

392.title: Amit Shah should be last person to talk about law & order: TMC leader
392.article_body: Trinamool Congress leader Saugata Roy criticised Union Home Minister Amit Shah for his remarks on the law and order situation in West Bengal, adding that he should be the last person to talk about it. "We are very well aware of his track record as a Minister in Gujarat and in the Union government," he said.

393.title: No election symbol allotted by EC will be deemed national symbol: Rijiju
393.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju told Rajya Sabha on Thursday that no election symbol allotted by Election Commission (EC) will be deemed as religious or national one. Rijiju's reply came after he was asked whether symbols like national bird etc, can be used by political parties. He added that government has no proposal to disallow use of national symbols by parties.

394.title: It's revolting: Presenter who received 31 videos of penis from a man on Instagram
394.article_body: A man sent 31 videos of his penis to Britain's 36-year-old TV presenter Rachel Riley through Instagram direct messages (DMs), Center for Countering Digital Hate (CCDH) researchers found. Riley, actress Amber Heard and other celebrities gave their social media accounts to non-profit CCDH for monitoring DMs. "It makes me not want to go into my DMs because...it's revolting," Riley said.

395.title: BankBazaar plans IPO in 2023; seeks to hire 1,500 employees
395.article_body: Online financial services marketplace BankBazaar plans to list an IPO in 2023, the company said on Thursday. After reporting revenue growth in FY22, the Sequoia India and Amazon-backed firm also plans to recruit over 1,500 employees across departments this year aiming to expand its product offerings. BankBazaar reported annualised revenue run rate of ₹156 crore, the company added.

396.title: Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies: Raut
396.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Thursday said Maharashtra will continue to stand tall before central agencies like the Enforcement Directorate and Narcotics Control Bureau. "Those who've announced a war against us and Maharashtra, I want to tell them that we're ready...A time will come when you will have to bow down on your knees before us," Raut added.

397.title: LSG, DC announce their playing XIs, DC make 3 changes as Warner returns
397.article_body: LSG captain KL Rahul won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 encounter on Thursday. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with Krishnappa Gowtham replacing Manish Pandey. DC have made three changes, with David Warner, Sarfaraz Khan and Anrich Nortje replacing Tim Seifert, Mandeep Singh and Khaleel Ahmed, respectively.

398.title: Was offered Heropanti 2 while shooting another film in UK: Nawazuddin
398.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he was offered 'Heropanti 2' while he was filming for another movie in London. "They narrated the character to me while we were travelling to a...location...later we took...narration to the hotel," he added. Nawazuddin stated he was impressed when writer Rajat Arora and director Ahmed Khan narrated the character with "a lot of zeal and enthusiasm".

399.title: Over 100 weapons banned for import to boost self-reliance: Rajnath Singh
399.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Thursday released the third list of over 101 military systems and weapons that will come under an import ban and be developed indigenously to boost self-reliance. "Our two important objectives are self-reliance in the defence sector and promoting exports of military equipment," Singh said. He added that self-reliance doesn't mean isolation from the world.

400.title: 'Dasvi' review says 'Yami no longer the dead girlfriend in Hindi films', actress reacts
400.article_body: Yami Gautam reacted to a review of her performance in 'Dasvi', which read, "Yami...is no longer...the dead girlfriend in Hindi films, but the...combative smile is starting to get repetitive." "I usually take constructive criticism in my stride. But when a...platform keeps trying to pull you down, I felt it necessary to speak up," she said while calling it "extremely disrespectful".
